IntroductionAre you looking for a career that will allow you to use your unique blend of business acumen and tech savvy? Business Analysts at IBM are subject matter experts that build the bridge between our business and our clients, immersing themselves into the market to understand problems and find innovative solutions. Be ready to navigate the complex relationships that make the business world run and find the actionable insights that result in great business decisions.Your Role and ResponsibilitiesHere at Watson Health, we’re looking for internally motivated, multi-talented resources to tackle some of the health insurance industry’s most challenging problems using industry leading IBM Watson Artificial Intelligence technology. As an Senior AI Business Analyst, you will work with healthcare clients and IBM industry leaders to help design and implement emerging solutions using Watson Artificial Intelligence. Our solutions help our clients to digitally reinvent their strategy and operations, driving greater efficiency and transformation of their entire enterprise through cognitive insights. Our practice allows you to grow in this “Hyper Growth” area and work directly with clients, building a powerful portfolio of diverse and rewarding experiences.Responsibilities include:Works with health insurance clients to define their AI strategy and determine the value proposition of an Artificial Intelligence SolutionLeads, directs, or participates in agile client requirement gathering discussions; develops and documents solution requirements, communicates and collaborates with technical resources in their actualizationWorks with client to develop conversational solution specification. Designs dialogs, utterances, intents, and synonyms using Watson AssistantAnalyzes and annotates health insurance benefits documents such as Summary Plan Documents and Benefits Booklets; builds NLP annotations, tools, and methods for ingestion by Watson Discovery Services (WDS), Watson Knowledge Studio (WKS), and related technologiesWorks with client to implement Watson Assistant for Health Benefits (WAHB) and related solution components such as WDS, WKS, and IBM Voice GatewayPerforms validation and quality assurance of implementation in a pre-production environment; supports related go-live activitiesInterfaces with the product team in the development of pre-built content for WAHB and introduces new requirements for the product roadmapRequired Technical and Professional Expertise2+ years consulting experience with the health insurance industry in a business analyst through managing consultant role (consulting level commensurate with experience)Hands-on experience with Watson Assistant or Watson Conversation Services; prior experience in health insurance conversational specification development and interfacing with developers daily for review / feedback / retrainingDeep understanding of healthcare terminology and benefits documents, ability to classify and break down content into component-level data for ingestion by the WAHB benefits analyzerDemonstrated behaviors of self-motivation, invention, agility, creativity, and the ability to make things happen in a rapid development environmentAbility to travel as neededPreferred Technical and Professional Expertise2+ years operational experience with the health insurance industryHands-on experience with Watson APIs or other AI technologiesPrior conversational AI implementation experienceCoding languages (HTML, Java / JavaScript, ReactJS, NodeJS)About Business UnitIBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.Your Life @ IBMWhat matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.Location StatementIBM offers a wide range of resources for eligible IBMers to thrive both inside and outside of work. In addition to a competitive benefits program consisting of medical and life insurance, retirement plans, and time off, eligible employees may also have access to:12 weeks of paid parental bonding leave. Family care options are also available to support eligible employees during COVID-19.World-class training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform. IBM's learning culture supports your restless attitude to grow your skills and build the depth and scale of knowledge needed to achieve your career goals.Well-being programs to support mental and physical health.Financial programs that empower you to plan, save, and manage your money (including expert financial counseling, 401(k), IBM stock discount, etc.).Select educational reimbursement opportunities.Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups where you can network and connect with IBMers across the globe.Giving and volunteer programs to benefit charitable organizations and local communities.Discounts on retail products, services, and experiences.We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

COME BUILD YOUR FUTURE WITH PRESIDIO!We know technology is the key to success in a connected world. The innovative solutions we provide our clients can unlock possibilities that transform their business. While technology permits that connection, technology without imagination and ingenuity cannot be effective. At Presidio, we know that it’s our people that make the connections happen.WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US? You will set your career on track for outstanding achievement with a company that knows no limits. Presidio is a leading IT solutions provider focused on Digital Infrastructure, Business Analytics, Cloud, Security & Emerging solutions.THE ROLE: Business Systems AnalystPresidio is seeking a Business Systems Analyst to join our team in a remote capacity. The Business Systems Analyst will be the liaison between internal customers and the development team for web-based business application development and system integrations. A strong background in data analysis, data integration, software, software integrations, and CRMs is desired.Key Responsibilities:Conduct interviews with multiple stakeholders to effectively elicit business and technical requirements.Analyze and consolidate the information using workflow diagrams and other visual toolsCompare the present state of the business processes and systems with the desired future state to provide gap analysis.Work with members of the development team to design a comprehensive solution that aligns with current system processes and functionality and meets the business goals and objectives; solutions may include designing new applications, designing new features in existing applications, integrating external or internal applications with existing applications, etc.Translate the solution into user stories, functional and technical system requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers, testers, stakeholders and the general project team.Work with stakeholders to prioritize requirements to meet both short term and long-term business goals.Make decisions and reprioritize work when unforeseen design changes are required during the development cycle and communicate those changes to the development and stakeholder teams.Perform end-to-end testing to ensure that the application meets the business and technical requirements.Effectively perform demos of new functionality, explaining business goals and process changes to support stakeholders in executing user acceptance testing.Document system updates in the form of release notes to educate both end users and service desk support. Manage and update system documentation, as needed.Continuously assist the end user community and provide level 2 support to the Service Desk for application support.Required Skills:Solid interpersonal, written and oral communication skills with the ability to effectively communicate and present to groups of all sizes, varying technical abilities and levels of the organization, both locally and remoteAbility to interview individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements informationEstablish and maintain effective working relationships with internal business units and outside partnersStrong analytical, strategic, and problem-solving skillsOrganized, efficient, detail oriented and self-motivatedHighly adaptable, flexible and willing to accept new ideas, processes and procedures in a rapidly evolving business and technical environmentAdditional Desired Skills:Experience in Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server and SQL Management Studio is preferredStrong finance and accounting backgroundEducation and Job ExperienceBachelor's Degree or the equivalent work and/or military experience3+ years' experience working as a Business Analyst on software development teamsProficiency in Microsoft Excel and VisioFundamental understanding of project management and agile software development methodologiesExperience with third party vendor integrations with ERP systems and other business applications*****ABOUT PRESIDIOPresidio is committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at the highest levels and has strengthened its drive to build and drive systemic DE&I change process across all levels of the organization. Cultivating a culture of inclusion where the expression of all our differences are valued, celebrated, and add to our collective achievements.Presidio is a leading global IT solutions provider assisting clients in harnessing technology innovation and simplifying IT complexity to digitally transform their businesses and drive return on IT investment. Our Digital Infrastructure, Business Analytics, Cloud, Security & Emerging solutions enable our almost 7,000 middle market, enterprise, and government clients to take advantage of new digital revenue streams, omnichannel customer experience models, and the rich data insights generated by those interactions.We serve as an extension of our clients’ IT teams, providing deep expertise and letting them focus on their core business. Within Presidio’s 40+ US offices and offices in Ireland, London, Singapore, and India, we support 2,800+ professionals, including 1,600 technical engineers. Presidio is a trusted advisor to our clients on a national level while also bringing our global scale and expertise to bear.For more information visit: www.presidio.com *****Presidio is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer / VEVRAA Federal Contractor. All qualified candidates will receive consideration for this position regardless of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, ethnicity, veteran status, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identification or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state and local statutes, regulations and ordinances.To read more about discrimination protections under Federal Law, please visit: https://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf (Get Acrobat Reader)If you have any difficulty using our online system and need an accommodation in the job application process due to a disability, please send an email to recruitment@presidio.com for assistance.Presidio is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor requesting priority referrals of protected veterans for its openings. State Employment Services, please provide priority referrals to recruitment@presidio.com. RECRUITMENT AGENCIES PLEASE NOTE:Agencies/3rd Parties may not solicit to any employee of Presidio. Any candidate information received from any Agency/3rd Party will be considered a gift and property of Presidio, unless the Agency/3rd Party is an Authorized Vendor of Presidio with an up-to-date Presidio Contract in hand signed by Presidio Talent Acquisition. No payment will be made to any Agency/3rd Party who is not an Authorized Vendor, nor has specific approval in writing from Presidio Talent Acquisition to engage in recruitment efforts for Presidio. #LI-PH1#CB

Position overview

The Business Analyst, Private Client Practice, will be an integral part of the global Private Client Practice leadership team. The Business Analyst will support the Global Practice Head as well as the Chief Operating Officer, Regional Heads and other members of the Private Client Practice leadership team to make progress against our strategic goals. The Business Analyst will provide critical analytical insights, drive forward key projects and assist the Global Head and COO on strategic issues that will contribute to establishing and maintaining the operational infrastructure and reporting needed to help the Private Client Practice deliver on business objectives. While based in Boston, this role will support the Global Private Client Leadership team members located in Beijing, Boston, London, New York & Singapore.

Job responsibilities

Primary responsibilities:


Support Practice Leadership decision-making by analyzing internal data and developing models related to key practice goals and objectives such as resource planning, global business development initiatives, performance management and talent development
Maintain Private Client data on business growth, clients, performance track record, etc.
Support the Private Client Practice leadership team in developing presentation materials for key meetings for the practice as well as for the leadership of the firm, including but not limited to:



Weekly Executive Management Report (EMR)
Monthly practice meeting materials (also responsible for meeting minutes)
Monthly wrap write ups
Asia Accelerated Growth Plan


Meeting notes with key takeaways and to dos for all leadership team members for standing weekly and other team meetings
Serve as a liaison with various individuals and teams across the firm to gather data and perspectives to inform the work
Partner with COO to facilitate Operating Model Focus group and support related cross department initiatives

Additional responsibilities:


Partner closely with other members of the Private Client Practice leadership and business development teams
Support ad hoc initiatives or projects across private client leadership, operations, client engagement and business development teams
Improve efficiency of practice team resource models
Track and advance Private Client practice client-facing professionals’ adoption of new analytical tools into their day-to-day work and help aggregate challenges and develop solutions to ensure tools support the specific needs of the private client practice
Design and maintain tools for tracking practice leadership project pipeline
Ensure Practice’s internal homepage is kept up to date with relevant content

Qualifications

BA/BS
2-3 years’ experience serving as a front-line analyst or consultant in an investment management, financial services or strategy consulting firm; or 18 months for internal candidates
Proven analytical skills; experience looking at disparate data sets and gleaning relevant insights
Experience managing projects and driving to completion
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to work independently and on a team
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to partner with colleagues across the firm, including communicating effectively with senior management
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of investment management preferred (but not required)
Expertise with Microsoft suite (Excel, Word, Powerpoint)

Interest in and aptitude for working with collaboration software (e.g., Jive Software)

job_title: Credit Analyst, Commercial Lending at Walpole Co-operative Bank
description: Credit Analyst, Commercial LendingWalpole Co-operative BankWalpole, MAAbout Walpole Co-operative BankWalpole Co-operative Bank is a community bank dedicated to meeting the needs of the communities we have served for the last century. Our office is located in the heart of Walpole and our focus has always been helping local people, businesses and non-profit organizations reach their goals. Our perspective is unique because it is local and hyper-focused on the specific needs of our wonderful community. We are a high performing, financially sound, independent community bank. Our commitment is to provide quality banking solutions that support the economic vitality of the individuals and businesses within the markets we serve. This commitment strengthens local communities, creating a positive impact on people’s lives.Walpole Co-operative Bank believes in rewarding its employees for their hard work and contributions to the team. Employees enjoy a comprehensive benefits package including a 401(k) and Pension Plan.Position SummaryWalpole Co-operative Bank is seeking an experienced Credit Analyst to join the Commercial Lending team. Working with the Senior Vice President, Senior Lender and other lenders, the Credit Analyst, Commercial Lending, reviews and assesses existing and new commercial accounts. The Credit Analyst, Commercial Lending, will also assist with loan portfolio administration, complete special assignments, projects, and reports.Job ResponsibilitiesPrepare comprehensive and timely loan presentations and analysis for loan requests including financial analyses of borrowers’ and guarantors’ financial information, collateral valuation, risk assessment and recommendation for credit grade and loan structureAssist with loan portfolio management by meeting with customers and prospective borrowers, visiting projects, preparing annual reviews, loan modifications, obtaining and reviewing current financial information, and reviewing closing documentation for accuracy and completeness; ensure loans are closed in accordance to bank policy, state and federal regulationsPerform other credit administrative tasks, generate Business Analytics and Fiserv reports, assist with preparation of reports and presentations for Senior Management and the Board of DirectorsEnsure accuracy and Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practice (USPAP) compliance of appraisals by timely review, preparation of internal evaluations, and review of appraisals for subsequent transactionsContribute to timely completion of loan audits/reviews by reviewing credit and collateral files to ensure financial information and credit analyses are current and loan documentation is complete and accurateMaintain updated knowledge regarding loan products, compliance and lending regulations, loan policies, and accepted credit practices; attend periodic seminars as requiredQualifications and SkillsBachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experienceTwo years of commercial credit experience and formal credit training preferredEffective analysis skillsExcellent writing and presentation skillsExcellent organization and time management abilitiesAbility to work effectively with multi-levels of managementAbility to maintain accuracy and meet tight deadlines and timeframesDisclaimers:Applicants, as well as position incumbents, who become disabled as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act must be able to perform the essential job functions (as listed) either unaided or with the assistance of a reasonable accommodation to be determined by management on a case by case basis.Walpole Co-operative Bank is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity. Forward Financing has been one of the fastest-growing Fintech companies in Boston for the past three years, as recognized by Boston Business Journal, Inc. Magazine, and Deloitte's Fast 500. Our mission is to be the leading provider of alternative financing solutions to under-served small businesses. We accomplish this by investing in our people, our technology, and our customer experience – with long-term success in mind. We are proud to be named to Boston Business Journal's Best Places to Work in 2020.As a Sr. Analyst on the FP&A team, you will report to the Director of FP&A, work closely with the Accounting / Finance team, and collaborate frequently with Leadership across the organization to help guide critical decisions within the Company. You will play an important role in defining, building out, and managing the Company's strategic Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) processes, and will provide valuable insight that will be used to assess the performance of Forward Financing and drive change within the company. This role will help shape the future of the FP&A team.In this role you will:Leverage your skills in financial analysis and experience with Excel to derive meaningful insights.Deliver weekly/monthly/quarterly analysis and reporting of financial results, including variances to forecast and budget; ensure key issues, risks, and business drivers are clearly understood by LeadershipPerform on-going "deep-dive" analysis into the Company's operating expenses.Work with stakeholders across the Company to implement FP&A best practices and frameworks to analyze the Company.Partner with internal stakeholders to develop capacity plans, annual budgets and quarterly forecasts, ensuring a robust understanding of key operational and financial drivers.Perform financial benchmarking and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess business fundamentals.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to provide value-added financial and strategic analysis, and support of business reviews and decisions from the financial perspective, including but not limited to, operational efficiency, cost-saving opportunities, vendor selection and negotiation, contract management, etc.Consult with stakeholders to assess the ROI on various initiatives (e.g. pricing; technology roadmap; unit economics).Learn and help manage the company's three statement operating model.About You:Passionate: You love what you do, and you have a positive attitude. You care about your teammates and the results of your work while demonstrating humility.Coachable: Open to feedback and continual professional improvement. Flexible and adaptable.Communicator: Speaks and writes clearly and articulately and likes to build strong relationships. Openly listens to learn and shows appreciation for other points of view.High Standards: Quality orientation. Follow through on commitments. A doer who gets things done.Efficient: Producing significant output with minimal wasted effort, organized planning and prioritization.Proactive: Self-starter who appropriately tackles problems and gets stuff done without the need for constant oversight. Continually seeks additional responsibilities while asking for, and acting on, feedback.Collaborative: Approaches work with a "people first" attitude and is a team player. Able to engage in healthy and helpful conflict.Emotional Intelligence: high degree of self-awareness. Handles interpersonal relationships judiciously and empathetically. Exercises good judgement while under pressure.Requirements:Bachelor's Degree.2-5 years of related experience, including but not limited to: financial modeling and forecasting, budgeting, evaluation of KPIs, financial benchmarking.1 year minimum in an FP&A role.Experience and comfort with deriving insights from data in Excel (e.g. sumif, sumproduct, index/match, vlookup, pivot tables, etc.)Proven ability to think analytically, while also possessing exemplary financial skills and excellent communication.About Us:Forward Financing is a Boston-based financial technology company that provides fast, flexible working capital to small businesses nationwide. Our dedicated account representatives and advanced proprietary technology help our customers spend less time finding capital and more time growing their businesses. With a simple online application, business owners can trust that Forward Financing works to get them approvals within minutes, funding within hours, and personalized support when they need it most.Since 2012, Forward Financing has expanded Main Street's access to capital by providing over $950 million in funding to more than 25,000 small businesses. The company is A+ rated by the Better Business Bureau and consistently receives top ratings across all major customer review platforms. Forward Financing has been named by both Inc. Magazine and the Boston Business Journal as one of Massachusetts' fastest-growing companies each year since 2017. Forward Financing was also named on both the Boston Business Journal's and Built In's respective "Best Places to Work" lists in 2020.While our office is located in the heart of Boston's Financial District, our staff is currently working remotely during the COVID-19 pandemic. Our diverse, driven team of over 100 people is passionate about helping thousands of small businesses while advancing their own careers. If this sounds like something you'd like to be a part of, learn more at www.forwardfinancing.com.CCPA Notice at Collection for California Job Applicants

oversee the translation of functional requirements into software productsAct as potential system administrator for business systems and/or related infrastructureDevelop or contribute to the development of users guidesPerform user acceptance testingPerform user training on business systemsAnalyze user, process, and systems data and create executive analytics dashboardsParticipate in and actively lead projects within ITQualifications and Skills:Bachelor’s degree in a related field5-7 years of relevant hands-on experienceExposure to CRM or Business Intelligence software is a plusExperience working on multiple projects with time sensitive deadlinesExperience leading requirements-gathering sessionsMust be able to communicate with non-technical (business) and technical (development) audiencesWillingness to take ownership of activities outside direct job responsibilities, when necessaryExcellent verbal and written communication skillsFlexibility and adaptability working in a fluid environment where visions and requirements may changeProficient in MS Word, Visio and ProjectHighly organizedVendor management experienceFamiliarity with software design and development preferredMicrosoft SQL Server and Windows Server Operating Systems experience preferredIt is the policy of Pension Reserves Management Board to afford equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons regardless of race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, disability, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression or gender unless based upon a bona fide occupational qualification.

Challenging convention. Trying new things. Reshaping an industry.

The team at Duck Creek helps insurance companies bring amazing ideas to life quickly and easily with software that thinks and works like they do. We're fueled by sharing ideas openly, challenging conventions, trying new things, and valuing "Why not?" over "Why?" Our certainty that there is always a better way to do things keeps carriers ahead of their competition and is helping to reshape an industry.

If having a hand in transforming one of the world’s oldest and largest industries into a standard for innovation, open exchange, and peerless user experience sounds exciting, let us know. We may be looking for you.

Senior Business Analyst

The Senior Business Analyst is an experienced resource on a project team responsible for analyzing and designing new business processes. The Senior Business Analyst will participate in documenting customer requirements to assist the development team in implementation.

Responsibilities:

Acts as an experienced resource on a project team responsible for analyzing and designing new business processesWorks with the Business Architect and other stakeholders to assess current capabilities and identify high-level customer requirements.Elicits detailed product requirements and use cases, and develop and maintain the business requirements.Participates in documenting customer requirements to assist the development team in implementation.Transitions the requirements and use cases to the technical team, and ensure a clear and complete understanding of the requirements.Participates in quality management reviews as outlined in the Quality Management practice, in particular reviews of the designs, prototypes and other requirement work products.Translates requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product and user acceptance testing.Performs other related duties and activities as required.

Requirements:

Education and Work Experience:

Bachelor’s degree required, or higher education level, or foreign equivalent, preferably in area with analytic emphasisMinimum of 8 years’ professional experience, preferably in a similar roleExperience interfacing with customers, including customer presentations

Specialized Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities:

Excellent communication skills, verbal and writtenExperience in requirements gathering, identifying gaps, estimating, implementation, test planning and execution, and User Acceptance Testing definition and executionExperience translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for assembly, product, and user acceptance testingExperience/knowledge of P&C Insurance software applicationsExperience/knowledge of software development life cycle for P&C insurance software

Other Requirements:

Travel: 25%Work Authorization: Legally authorized to work in the country of the job location.Physical: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. BenefitsWe value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits.Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace an environment that is free from all discrimination in the workplace, in our business, or by our vendors. Liberty Mutual values diversity and the differences and similarities of our employees. We foster a diverse and inclusive work environment that leads to better ideas, stronger teams and more creative products and services for our customers.Advance your career at Liberty Mutual Insurance – a Fortune 100 Company!The CompanyLiberty Mutual Investments (LMI) manages Liberty Mutual Insurance Group’s (LMIG) global financial assets across global and private domains to build capital and generate income. With over $90 billion in AUM and staffed with nearly 300 investment, finance and operations professionals located in Boston, MA, we offer the best of both worlds — the look and feel of a boutique investment firm and the reputation and financial strength of a global leader.LMI has been on a transformation path to spur innovation, capitalize on deep expertise and scale its returns on long-term flexible capital through a “one firm, one portfolio, one team” mindset. Our operating model is built on three pillars: centralized portfolio construction, asset management and investment-enabling services. The teams are structured as Investment Business Units (IBUs) working in concert: Strategy & Asset Allocation, Risk Management, Global Fixed Income, Global Partnerships & Innovation and Investment Enabling Services (IES). Our portfolio spans a broad spectrum of public and private asset classes, and we are committed to expanding our capabilities and our toolkit in furtherance of our mission.LMIG is proud to be recognized for a second time in 2019 as a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune magazine and as a Great Place to Work.The PositionLiberty Mutual Investments (LMI) is actively searching for a Portfolio Credit Senior Analyst to join the Global Fixed Income team. This individual will be part of a growing leveraged finance platform increasingly focused on deploying capital into private markets. In this role, you will be an integral member of the credit team with responsibilities that provide for wing-to-wing exposure to the asset management process, from the screening and evaluation of new business opportunities to the management and optimization of the portfolio. You will work directly with the credit investments team, including the Director of Private Credit, Portfolio Managers, and Analysts in a dynamic and cross-functional team environment.Specifically, and with the goal of elevating team performance, the Credit Portfolio Senior Analyst will lead the buildout of key data analytics used to guide portfolio construction and ongoing monitoring of the quality of the portfolio. This person will support the senior credit team in establishing internal reporting rhythms across private credit assets and in preparing performance data used to actively manage the portfolio. The Credit Portfolio Senior Analyst will also actively assist in business development and execution activities for the Private Credit portfolio, including the evaluation and underwriting of direct lending fund investments. This individual will bring an entrepreneurial mindset to the role, critical to tackling the breadth of responsibilities required and to meeting an expanding, high growth business mandate.ResponsibilitiesProvide support to senior credit team in the prospecting and evaluation of new investments in direct lending funds, as well as in the monitoring of existing direct lending fund investments within the leveraged finance portfolio.Support the Director of Private Credit in numerous business development initiatives including the creation of marketing materials and the sourcing of new strategic relationships.Manage the Private Credit deal pipeline, providing timely market intelligence to the senior credit team for both market pricing and deal terms.Track and analyze comprehensive position data across high yield bonds, broadly syndicated loans, and private loans; establish consistent data sources and collection frequency levels necessary to manage and compare positions, and to harvest learnings from the data set.Drive monthly and quarterly reporting with an emphasis on analyzing and measuring credit and financial performance in the portfolio from multiple perspectives including asset class, product, industry. Summarize conclusions and implications from the prepared analysis and present findings to senior credit team.Proactively stay abreast of portfolio construction guidelines and inform senior team of findings and recommendations.Undertake research to identify more meaningful ways to analyze and present information, and work with senior credit team to highlight the risks and opportunities within the non-investment grade credit portfolio.Work closely with the Risk team to address portfolio health and ratings assessments, including ensuring data is timely and accurate.Collaborate with key internal teams to continually enhance data quality and to establish internal audit and reconciliation processes of individual credit attributes and performance.Strong financial foundation with a BS in Finance, Economics, or Accounting preferred2 - 5 years' experience in a finance or accounting function, with previous exposure to lending products or graduation from a financial leadership program preferredRobust analytical and quantitative background with the ability to manipulate and analyze large data setsHigh comfort level working in Excel and PowerPoint (Bloomberg, Blackrock Aladdin, Efront, and Macrolab also preferred)Producer of detail-oriented, accurate and consistent work productDesire to, and professionalism necessary to, interact with external constituencies including private equity sponsors and direct lending partnersAbility to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment with the flexibility to shift from task to task, and to handle various projectsPossesses strong project, process, and time management skillsSelf-motivated with the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively across a team-oriented environment

job_title: Senior Quality, Safety, Health Equity Data Analyst / 40 Hours / BWH APSI
description: Senior Quality, Safety, Health Equity Data Analyst / 40 Hours / BWH APSI - (3148255)General Summary/Overview:The Senior Data Analyst, Analytics, Reporting, and Insights (ARI) is responsible for identifying, querying, analyzing, and presenting through reports and presentations, a variety of data to support quality and performance measurement initiatives throughout Brigham and Women’s and Brigham and Women’s Faulkner Hospitals. This will require close collaboration with staff within the clinical departments, and many other analytic, quality, financial, and business planning groups throughout the hospital. Data and reporting support could encompass areas such as patient satisfaction survey programs, quality and patient safety reporting, clinical outcome performance tracking, asset utilization and measurement support, finance, business development, and others. The successful Senior Data Analyst will analyze and organize complex qualitative and quantitative clinical, financial and administrative data from multiple data sources, and synthesize results into meaningful reports and presentations on a regular basis, leveraging Tableau tools, SQL querying and Excel analysis, Epic reporting tools such as reporting workbench and radar, as well as other tools such as R, SAS, and Python. S/he will leverage their skills working with large data sets, distilling data down into digestible information, for consumption by hospital senior leadership and staff across the organization. They will serve as a resource and role model for other ARI data analysts, and train other analysts and end-users on core analytic and reporting capabilities.Principle Duties and Responsibilities:Elicits data and reporting requirements from hospital leadership, clinicians, and other staff, using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, site visits, use cases, scenarios, data analysis, task, and workflow analysis.\Determines appropriate tools to meet the end user’s data and reporting needs, inclusive of Brigham Health’s Epic reporting tools such as Radar, Reporting Workbench, Clarity and Caboodle, as well as adhoc data analysis through querying the Brigham Health data warehouse and delivering via Excel or PowerPoint, or developing Tableau dashboards for historical, analytical reporting.Performs data analysis against hospital systems such as our electronic medical record system (Epic), enterprise data warehouse (EDW), Balanced Scorecard, SAS data sets, MS Access databases, external websites, and Tableau in order to glean meaningful insights and produce actionable reports for internal customers.Presents data and analyses to key stakeholder groups as requested, including creating materials for and giving presentations as needed.Works with ARI staff in design, maintenance, and distribution of reports while also overseeing ad hoc data analyses and new report development as needed.Works with Analytics, Reporting, and Insights team to support, maintain and further develop our analytical capabilities with SAS, Tableau, and other analytic platforms, which includes but not limited to dashboard and report development, QA of existing reports, and documentation of system functionality.Performs comprehensive quality assurance, ensuring that databases and reports meet end user specifications and data are accurate and reliable.Works with new and existing ARI analysts to share knowledge in methods of data analysis, summarization and presentation. Trains other analysts and end-users on key analytic and reporting systems and databases.Perform data cleansing and data entry tasks as necessary to support data analysis and reporting.Represents ARI on internal and external committees or task forces as needed.Performs all other related duties as required.Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in management, information systems, statistics, or equivalent experience.At least 3-5 years of experience, preferably in a related analytics position.Working knowledge of SQL and Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau , Business Objects, SAS BI, or others preferred.Knowledge and application of statistical analyses including financial variance analysis and statistical significance preferred.Some knowledge of electronic medical record system data preferredProject management skills and/or experience a plus.MS Access and/or SQL Server database experience a plus.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint.Skills and Abilities:Strong proficiency with Excel, manipulating large data sets and synthesizing into digestible information.Experience with querying relational databases as well building dashboards and reports using business intelligence tools such as Tableau (preferred), MicroStrategy, SAP Business Objects, Cognos, etc..Strong ability to work effectively with senior level management, and staff at all levels within an organization.Experience with data manipulation, cleansing, and statistical analysis using tools such as SAS, R, Python, Power BI, and other tools.Ability to clearly communicate complex and sensitive data to senior executives as well as peers.Strong written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to tailor message to individuals and audiences throughout the institution.Strong organizational skills, with the ability to focus detailed concentrated effort to multiple projects and re-establish priorities as necessary.Possesses initiative and ability to work independently while thriving in a setting requiring collaboration and teamwork for maximal efficiency and effectiveness.Attention to detail that ensures follow through on all initiatives implemented, and all projects undertaken.Ability to effectively respond to time sensitive issues and meet deadlines.EEO StatementBrigham and Women's Hospital is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.Primary Location MA-Boston-BWH Boston Main CampusWork Locations BWH Boston Main Campus 75 Francis St Boston 02115Job Professional/ManagerialOrganization Brigham & Women's Hospital(BWH)Schedule Full-timeStandard Hours 40Shift Day JobEmployee Status RegularRecruiting Department BWH APPIJob Posting Mar 16, 2021

We foster a diverse and inclusive work environment that leads to better ideas, stronger teams and more creative products and services for our customers.The CompanyLiberty Mutual Investments (LMI) manages Liberty Mutual Insurance Group’s (LMIG) global financial assets across public and private domains to build capital and generate income. With over $80 billion in AUM and staffed with 250-plus investment, finance, and operations professionals located in Boston, Massachusetts, we offer the best of both worlds — the look and feel of a boutique investment firm and the reputation and financial strength of a global leader.LMI has been on a transformational path to spur innovation, capitalize on deep expertise, and scale its returns on long-term flexible capital through a “one firm, one portfolio, one team” mindset. Our operating model is built on three pillars: centralized portfolio construction, asset management, and investment-enabling services. The teams are structured as Investment Business Units (IBUs) working in concert: Strategy & Asset Allocation, Risk Management, Global Fixed Income, Global Partnerships & Innovation, and Investment Enabling Services. Our portfolio spans a broad spectrum of public and private asset classes, and we are committed to expanding our capabilities and our toolkit in furtherance of our mission.LMIG is proud to be recognized for a second time in 2019 as a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune magazine and as a Great Place to Work.LMI is actively searching for a Senior Analyst to join the Strategy & Asset Allocation (SAA) team. SAA is the nerve center of LMI, responsible for developing the tools and insights necessary for deconstructing the macro/market narrative, informing top-down house views, proposing cross-asset trades, setting the asset allocation for the General Account (GA), and directly managing the GA’s public equity exposure as well as the Pension. Does working for a fast paced, growing company that is making a difference in our environment excite you? Do you have a passion for making our environment better for this generation and the ones that follow? Let's make a difference together. Join our team!SUMMARYNexamp's Marketing team is responsible for acquiring and retaining subscribers for Nexamp's community solar programs and other clean energy services. Our mission is focused on helping more people access the benefits of solar energy and the savings that come with it. We're a data-driven team focused on constantly optimizing our programs to reach more people and do so more efficiently. We're a team of creators who are building interest in decarbonization as a less expensive energy choice. As a team, we are passionate about what we do and about exploring ways to expand our mission beyond our existing lines of business. RESPONSIBILITIESThe Lead Marketing Analyst will become an expert on all data within Nexamp's community solar customer base: how is it generated and captured; how should it be modeled in our internal system; what it means for our future growth as a company.Work with our Product Management and Software Development teams ("DPI") to evolve Nexamp's marketing data infrastructure and position it for future growth.Be hands-on in operating data insights tooling for core business functions.Guide in-house Development & Product team in selecting tools and methods for building Nexamp's data infrastructure.Dive deep into the data to understand how customer behavior changes with the evolution of our products and features.Design and build dashboards, enabling stakeholders to diagnose and resolve issues quickly.Work closely with stakeholders to identify critical business objectives, scope analytics projects and brainstorm solutions enabled by analytics.Design, scope, and analyze A/B tests to optimize marketing campaigns best.Advise engineering/technology on best practices for data capture to support meaningful analytics.Embrace and adapt to challenges presented by from raw, unstructured, or semi-structured data.Set annual goals based on ability to generate step-change improvements to core business functions through improved analytics. QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degree in a quantitative field; advanced degree a plus3-5 years of relevant analytics experience, ideally at a company focused on consumer acquisition and retentionExcellent technical skills: expert experience with SQL and at least one data visualization / BI tool (Power BI, Looker, Tableau, Spotfire)Experience working with large external parallel datasets (e.g. Redshift)Experience with analytics across multiple internal and external data setsExcellent analytical and interpersonal skillsAbility to communicate effectively at all levels and articulate ideas, results, and recommendationsAbility to prioritize work independently, ensuring accuracy while meeting deadlinesExperience managing a direct report is preferredPERKS & COMPENSATIONNot only will you get to work with a group of innovative, dedicated, and motivated peers, you will also have access to all the benefits that Nexamp Offers! This includes: our competitive compensation package; a 401 (k) employer-match; health, dental, & vision insurance with company contribution; Flexible Paid Time Off; Commuter Benefits and Cell Phone Reimbursement. We provide healthy snacks, coffee, in-office and online yoga sessions, volunteer opportunities, company outings, and more!NEXAMP VALUES AND MISSIONBuilding the future of energy so it is clean, simple and accessibleNexamp is building the energy infrastructure of tomorrow and reinventing the way people interact with the electricity that powers their lives. By deploying a distributed network of locally sourced clean energy, we seek to reduce the negative effects of climate change. Our team's diverse experience drives innovation from the ground up and with a singular passion: to deliver an accessible and sustainable energy future for all.

The Space Systems Analysis and Test Group identifies and evaluates threats to U.S. use of space for military, intelligence, civil and commercial purposes. This work involves understanding the attributes and vulnerabilities of U.S. space-related systems, including the sensors and networks used to detect, track, and characterize objects in space, the satellites that provide space-based services, and the infrastructure used to control and operate these satellites. A central component of this effort involves consideration of how adversaries might try to exploit U.S. vulnerabilities; assessing the risk of exploitation involves technically evaluating the knowledge and resources required to mount a credible threat against our systems. This work requires detailed modeling of optical, radar, and propulsion systems; novel ideas for new space systems and on-orbit operations; and understanding the timelines, architectures, and decision-making processes for maintaining awareness of the space environment. In addition, the group pursues potentially game-changing, innovative ideas for remote sensing of space and the Earth. This part of our work involves sensor design, signal and image processing as well as space object and environmental phenomenology. The group seeks researchers from the physical sciences, including physics, mathematics, and chemistry, as well as from a wide range of applied disciplines (including electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, chemical engineering, aeronautics, astronautics and computer science).We are seeking a Business Manager for the Space Systems Analysis & Test Group. The Business Manager’s role entails management of all aspects of the Group’s administrative and business functions, including the Group’s financial portfolio and day to day operations of the Group. As an integral member of Group’s management team, the Business Manager will partner with the Group Office to ensure smooth and efficient operations of the Group. The Business Manager’s financial responsibilities include cost estimation, proposal preparation and new program package submissions, program funding updates, authorization of budget expenditures, and status of both program-specific and overall-group financial health. The Business Manager will also be responsible ensuring the Group’s administrative needs are met, including procurements, property, IT compliance, office and lab space planning and allocation, etcFinancial Analysis and ReportingIn collaboration with program managers and the Group Office, develop new program packages including initial cost estimates and funding profiles, ensuring consistency between Grey Book write-up, statement of work, quad chart, and anticipated funding entries.Create program/task level cost estimates (in conjunction with program managers) and track budget to actuals. Analyze trends and discrepancies from plan, track milestones and risk assessments.Collaborate with Group Leaders to implement and manage resource planning. Reach out to employees and subcontractors to track time allocation compared to each program’s spend plan.Manage program level financial reporting provided to sponsors and program managers. POSITION: SENIOR SYSTEMS ANALYST

Summary:

The Senior Systems Analyst is tasked with identifying and analyzing strategic data related issues and needs. This includes assessing the tools available, defining the optimal solution, managing the solution through development, testing, and implementation, and then maintaining and supporting the new solution in the production environment with updates and enhancements as necessary. This position requires a willingness to proactively learn and lead projects forward, including the face of uncertainty.

Key Result Areas:

§ Take the lead on developing processes and appropriate solutions that address strategic data needs and objectives throughout the Bank

§ Thorough understanding of what a business unit is trying to accomplish, work with various departments to create data queries to support their business needs

§ Create, monitor, and troubleshoot all levels of SQL queries

§ Assist the Business Intelligence Analyst to develop and modify visual dashboards, using data analytical tools, for various areas of the bank

§ Contribute to the effective team management of all bank problems, issues and opportunities

§ Perform additional duties as required

Qualifications:

§ College education or equivalent and 5+ years of equivalent work experience

§ 5+ years of experience working with T-SQL and PL-SQL

§ 3+ years of experience working with various CRMs (Ex: EnAct, Encompass, or Salesforce) to support the product in house

§ 1+ years’ experience with data analytical tools such as TIBCO Spotfire or Tableau

§ 1+ years’ experience with document management systems (OnBase/Nautilus), preferred

§ 5+ years of experience with scripting languages, regular expressions preferred

§ 5+ years of related Oracle or SQL database experience

§ 2+ years of experience with Visual Studio for creating SQL packages

§ 2+ years of experience with C# preferred

§ Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

§ Strong analytical and organizational skills and ability to work independently and multitask

§ Proficient with Microsoft products, specifically Excel and Access

The above description covers the most significant responsibilities but does not exclude other occasional responsibilities and accountabilities, the inclusion of which would be in conformity with the major purpose of this job.

POSITION: SENIOR TREASURY ANALYST

Summary:

Responsible for various operational, reporting and analytical functions related to liquidity management, cash-flow modeling and financial reporting. This individual plays an active role in supporting the Bank’s Treasury department.

Key Result Areas:

§ Provide primary support for efficient cash management and investment settlements by administering daily management of the Bank’s liquidity position, monitoring daily cash flows, and gauging excess/deficit in funding requirements

§ Assist with calculations to Sell and/or purchase excess/deficit funds daily with network of financial counterparties

§ Monitor safekeeping and custodial activity for Bank’s investment portfolio, assisting the accounting group by researching non-reconciled discrepancies between Bank’s accounting records and custodian banks

§ Collect and maintain historic interest rates, economic indicators and other market data from various sources, including Bloomberg

§ Produce comprehensive reporting materials for Liquidity (Daily), Asset Liability Management (monthly), and Board (monthly) meeting strict deadlines

§ Record meeting minutes for monthly ALCO meetings

§ Provide adhoc modeling and analysis as needed in support of specific but widely varying strategic initiatives. This would include modeling deposit pricing on new and existing products and modeling impact of various growth strategies on income and interest rate risk

§ Assist in administration of Swap program by providing documentation, both pre-trade and post-trade as well as work with lenders, underwriters, closing attorneys, servicing department, and other counterparties

§ Assist with Internal and external audits, FDICIA, and other reviews as needed

§ Establish and maintain effective working relationships with other employees and customers

§ Contribute to the effective team management of all Bank problems, issues, and opportunities

Qualifications:

§ BS degree, preferably in finance or economics

§ Minimum 1 to 2 years of banking experience

§ Working knowledge of banking industry

§ Strong analytical and communication skills.

§ Advanced software skills including modeling, spreadsheet and presentation functions

§ Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

§ Effective time-management skills and comfortable meeting strict deadlines

The above description covers the most significant responsibilities but does not exclude other occasional responsibilities and accountabilities, the inclusion of which would be in conformity with the major purpose of this job.

Job DescriptionCompany SummaryTired of looking at the same jobs in the high-tech industry? Have you ever considered working in the wine, beer & spirits industry – well now is your chance! Constellation Brands (NYSE: STZ and STZ.B), a Fortune 500® company, is a leading international producer and marketer of beer, wine, and spirits with operations in the U.S., Canada, Mexico, New Zealand, and Italy.Constellation is the No. 3 beer company in the U.S. with high-end, iconic imported brands such as Corona Extra, Corona Light, Modelo Especial, Modelo Negra and Pacifico. The company’s beer portfolio also includes Funky Buddha, one of the most awarded craft brewers in the U.S. In addition, Constellation is the world’s leader in premium wine, selling great brands that people love, including Robert Mondavi, Kim Crawford, Meiomi and The Prisoner. The company’s premium spirits brands include SVEDKA Vodka, Casa Noble Tequila, and High West Whiskey. We express our company vision: to build brands worth reaching for, and to learn more, visit https://companyprofile.cbrands.com/.Constellation Brands has a flexible work environment that includes the ability to work remotely a few days a week!Position SummaryAs a Product Analyst, Sales Execution you will be the technology and process / functional expert focusing on Field Sales Enablement. You will join the product management team and will collaborate with business stakeholders, distributors, product managers and Agile Teams to define and prioritize new capabilities through user stories, personas, journey maps and UX designs. You will play a critical role in bringing both business and digital thought leadership to the Agile Squads to define and execute Product Roadmaps and measure business value.ResponsibilitiesWork with key business stakeholders and Product Managers to understand goals, enabling capabilities and success measures for digital initiatives.Develop deep knowledge in the Field Sales Enablement process; develop relationships with key business stakeholders to enable feature definition and roadmap execution.Ability to take a holistic product strategy and break it down into detailed requirements and acceptance criteria which can be leveraged by a cross-functional agile team.Work with the product management team to create and maintain core product artifacts including KPI’s, actual product performance vs. KPI’s, product roadmaps, user personas, journey maps, TCO models and product backlog for each product in their portfolio.Define or enhance business processes that improve team execution.Collaborate with other Product Analysts and Product Managers to define and align product roadmaps to ensure ecosystem integrity (mobile execution, planning, reporting, etc.).Utilize Design Thinking and business process modeling techniques to facilitate feature / story definition or UX design. Act as the functional subject matter expert in the assigned functional domain. Define and elaborate on key epics, develop stories and acceptance criteria that are actively managed as part of release planning / story grooming.Define success metrics for key capabilities and releases; on a quarterly basis analyze how the product is performing against key objectives.Accountable for delivery of business value / outcomes from prioritized roadmap items.Engage, educate, and support the super user network for the center of excellence for the specific applications within the defined process area.Qualifications3+ years’ experience in information systems and/or analytical business systems; some technical experience is highly desired, but this role is not a technical role.Product analyst or business process analyst experience in sales, marketing or supply chain is desired.Demonstrated experience supporting Agile squads implementing web / mobile / eCommerce solutions.Experience and familiarity with Agile methodologies and tools (Rally, JIRA, CI/CD).Strong communication skills in writing, speaking, and presenting.Able to communicate technical or complex subject matter in business terms.Demonstrated track record of creating technology solutions to solve business problems (globally, or across multiple divisions or regions within a single company).High attention to detail is essential.Analytical, problem solver.Education / Experience:Bachelor’s degree in business, information systems or computer science or related field with relevant work experience.3+ years’ experience with digital product strategy, consulting or delivery.Experience working in high-tech, CPG or retail where there is a multi-tier distribution model is preferred.LocationChicago, IllinoisAdditional LocationsCanandaigua, New York, Virtual - USJob TypeFull timeJob AreaInformation TechnologyEqual OpportunityConstellation Brands is committed to a continuing program of equal employment opportunity. All persons have equal employment opportunities with Constellation Brands, regardless of their sex, race, color, age, religion, creed, sexual orientation, national origin or citizenship, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer or genetic characteristics), marital status, gender (including gender identity or gender expression), familial status, military or veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related conditions (or any other group or category within the framework of the applicable discrimination laws and regulations).

Ability to interact effectively at all levels of an organizationResource motivation and management
Strong domain knowledge and context to understand client models and solutionsB2C/B2B e-commerce and product data experienceStrategic data-base analysis. problem solving and solution development skillsProficient with MS Office Suite, Data visualization and other digital tools & presentation toolsProficient in PDS platforms/tools such as InRiver, Enterworks, Stibo, Syndigo, PDS/Tagglo, TWS and excelDemonstrated experience documenting "as is" and "to be" workflows and processesProven ability to understand, contribute to and work within a structure project delivery methodology including managing billable hour requirements and internal time-trackingStrong written and verbal communication skillsMature work ethic, self starter and collaborative team memberA plus if you have the following:

About Verndale

Verndale is a customer experience agency, purpose-built to help marketing and technology leaders connect the dots of the consumer journey. From our offices in Boston, Los Angeles and Quito, we design and build digital experiences, and enable marketing technologies that bring brands and their customers closer together.

We know that in order to do great work, you have to make work great. Verndale is committed to always being a company that celebrates diversity, equality and inclusion. Verndales services are built around a core methodology that encompasses Growth Strategy, Experience Design, Technology Enablement, and Experience Optimization.

Who you are: You enjoy solving problems and have a talent for understanding business needs and helping to translate them into solutions. You are precise and focused, but you also make work fun; all while working collaboratively and giving your customer a great experience. You work well with team members and enjoy sharing your vision and innovative ideas with peers and clients to build elegant solutions.

Why this role matters: This role works on our project teams to understand what our healthcare and life sciences clients need. Our consultants are business and technology experts who work collaboratively with internal partners and our clients to create innovative cloud-based solutions.

 Engage with key stakeholders, leveraging business and technical resources, to facilitate discussions, analyze and evaluate options, and provide recommendations to the project team and client as appropriate.

 Assist team in evaluating results to allocate and prioritize requirements to support defined project and business objectives.
 Establish and support traceability from business objectives through functional requirements to technical specifications.
 Proactively communicate and collaborate with key stakeholders to document requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Process Maps, Business Requirements, Functional Requirements, SIT, and UAT Test Scripts.
 Keep requirement documents current; capture all changes as new revisions of systems documentation.
 Define and develop test scripts to be utilized during SIT and UAT and play an active consultative role during testing.
 Interact professionally with a diverse group of business leaders and technologists including executives, managers, and subject matter experts.

Requirements:


 Bachelor's level degree in business or technical discipline and 1-3 years or greater professional experience
 Prior consulting industry experience
 Prior experience in Life Sciences/Pharmaceutical / Healthcare environment
 Skilled in process modeling and business process design
 Experience authoring business and functional requirements documents and other technical documentation
 Skilled in creation of workflow diagram creation, system mockups using wire frame diagrams, Actors, and Use Cases
 Experience creating test plans and related documentation
Salesforce knowledge / experience would be ideal
 Strong verbal and written communication skills

Business Analyst

Job Location: Chicago, IL

Join our team

Centric Consulting is not the typical consulting company. We live our core values and bring them with us in all we do for our clients and community. Our core purpose is simple: every day we strive to provide unmatched customer and employee experiences and foster a culture of respect, diversity, and transparency. It’s this culture, our people, and delivery that come together to make Centric a trusted advisor to local businesses.

Our Chicago business unit is part of a larger group of business and technology experts at the company, but we add a lot of individual expertise and personality to our work. We care about positively influencing the people around us. To help accomplish this, we connect local leaders and encourage knowledge sharing. We’re looking for a Business Analyst to join our growing team.

In this role, you will:

Work with business subject matter experts and technical teams to gather project needs and translate them into functional and technical documentation.
Act as a general liaison between business and technical teams.
Create reference manuals, training material, and other technical documents as necessary.
Assist in the training of new users for the solution.
Work with test teams to enable the creation of test scenarios and plans.
Coordinate user acceptance testing with users.
Work with implementation teams to analyze and triage defects.
Work on agile projects (so, it’s a plus if you have experience writing user stories, creating acceptance criteria, stand-ups, product review sessions, backlog grooming meetings, retrospectives, sprint planning processes, and of automated testing processes).

A successful candidate will have the following characteristics:

At least 10+ years professional experience within a BA function
Previous top-tier management consulting experience (preferred)
Ability to lead client engagements and build stakeholder relationships and expectations
Ability to create unmatched experiences, for both clients and employees, is what we do. You should revel in doing the unexpected and extraordinary for others.
A learning mindset, ready to experience new ideas and situations regularly.
Consulting experience is strongly preferred. That said, you will also be considered if you have a strong industry background. We like to work in the communities we live in.
We want someone who likes to solve problems. Clients don’t come to us when the problem is easy. You should enjoy taking on the hard stuff.
And because we work with clients, excellent communication skills are important – both written and verbal. Translating technical concepts into layman’s terms is an essential skill.
Initiative is important. We don’t hand hold – you should be comfortable working independently in an entrepreneurial environment. That said, collaboration is equally important. Our Chicago team and other [technologists or consultants] at Centric will give you an amazing support system. You will lean on them daily.

What makes Centric different?

Special Culture – Our people make us different. We have highly talented, intelligent individuals across a broad variety of disciplines – who are eager to learn from you and share their own expertise. We embrace fresh perspectives and each other. Don’t take our word for it – check us out on Glassdoor, Facebook, Twitter or Instagram to get a glimpse inside what makes us different.
Growth opportunities – As a mid-size firm, there is more flexibility when it comes to career paths. Figure out what you want to do and we'll help you figure out how to get there.
Impact – We think of ourselves as a big company with a small company feel – a local player with global reach that combines business, technology and industry expertise.
Unmatched Experiences – We are allowed to be ourselves here. We are encouraged to be human. It’s at the root of who we are as a firm and why we’re here.
Innovation – We value passion, determination, perseverance, and innovation. We are inspired because we believe in what we are doing and where we are going.
Passion for the greater good – We are steadfast in our devotion to the communities we serve and in actively promoting employee involvement in community improvement projects.

Centric believes the best solutions come from diverse teams. We strive to have an environment where everyone has an opportunity to be successful regardless of their race, color, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation or gender identity.

The vision of Colorado Access is to have healthy communities transformed by the care that people want at a cost we can all afford. Our mission is to partner with communities and empower people through access to quality, affordable care.
Under the supervision of the Manager of Business Intelligence, the Business Intelligence Analyst III is responsible for supporting organizational decision-making through complex analysis, reporting, research, and effective use of data generated from our information systems. They will be within the Business Intelligence Department, providing extracted data sets, in-depth complex analyses, and reports to support the reporting needs of multiple lines of business.

· Serves as an integrated line of business team member ensuring that information needs are understood, complete specifications are identified, and the appropriate analysis, research, report, or other support is identified to address those needs. Analyzes and documents requirements through research, data gathering, and brainstorming activities. Designs and documents customer reporting and analytic requests by defining, creating, evaluating, and selecting alternatives. Key considerations in the selection process include:

o Colorado Access, Business Intelligence, and Line of Business strategic plan alignment

o Business problems and opportunities

o Operational efficiency

o Process improvement

o Techniques used in analysis and design include, but are not limited to:

§ Report Mockups

§ Analytical Project Design

· Transforms complex Business Intelligence requests, both internal and external, into useful products with actionable outcomes that utilize the most credible and efficient data source, subject to relevant materiality levels. Identifies and creates new data objects. Presents report results to Senior Management.

· Identifies actionable issues through data interpretation and research. Provides summary of trends, observations, and actionable items on complex reporting issues and development reports. Applies advanced data analysis and statistical techniques to answer any number of complex data questions and initiatives. Validates that output meets Line of Business needs. Partners with Line of Business Directors to “dig deeper” into output and identifies areas of further analysis.

· Utilizes a variety of software applications and data sources to develop methodologies for the Business Intelligence department and the Analysis and Reporting Team.

· Actively develops new tools and system enhancements, troubleshoots and solves data issues.

· Seeks out, identifies, documents, and initiates resolutions to data quality issues that are discovered during report and analysis development.

· Participates in available training programs and maintains an individual training/education strategy with immediate supervisor.

· In coordination with Department management, specific elements of the Company’s Strategic Plan will be identified as focus areas for this position and will be included as position responsibilities.

REQUIREMENTS:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in health care related area, statistics, computer systems, finance or accounting. Equivalent combination of experience and/or education may substitute with a preference for four years progressive relevant work experience.

Experience: Minimum of seven years’ experience in healthcare data related field with at least three years of SQL experience. Significant and demonstrated experience with advanced data reporting and analysis methods, data management and query tools including the use of Toad, Business Objects, Tableau, Python, or other similar tools required.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Expert understanding of health benefits, medical terminology, medical procedures, and managed care industry; expertise with CPT, ICD and other coding systems; demonstrated analytical, problem solving, and research ability as evidenced by experience in the identification of requirements and the definition, evaluation, and selection of appropriate solutions to business problems or opportunities. Demonstrates support for the company’s mission, vision and values.

Position requires excellent written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated ability for turning complicated verbal requests into reports and queries; ability to interpret complex data results and effectively summarize information that can be easily translated into company action. Must have strong interpersonal and teamwork skills with good organizational and time management skills. May be required to manage multiple priorities and projects with tight deadlines. Must be proficient in MS-Office applications (Excel, Access, Word, Power Point); experience with analytics tools or languages such as SAS, Python or R is a plus. Experience with data management and query tools, such as Power BI and Tableau and SQL Experience is required.

Licenses/Certifications: A valid driver's license and proof of current auto insurance will be required for any position requiring driving.

*Due to the pandemic, our employees are temporarily working at home. We require our workforce to reside in Colorado and telecommute, which may require you to come into the office as we serve our local communities.

COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:

Compensation: $51,500.00 - $94,500.00 annually. Pay rate/salary to be commensurate with experience.

Benefits: In addition to being part of a mission driven organization that serves our community, eligible Colorado Access employees receive a generous benefits package, including:



 Medical, Dental, & Vision starting the 1st day of the month following start date.

 Supplemental insurance such as critical illness and accidental injury.

 Healthcare and Dependent care flexible spending account options.

 Employer Paid Basic Life Insurance and AD&D (employee, spouse and dependent).

 Short-term and Long-term Disability Coverage.

 Voluntary Life Insurance (employee, spouse, dependent).

 Paid Time Off

 Retirement Plan

 Tuition Reimbursement (based on eligibility).

 Annual bonus program (based on eligibility, requirements and performance).

We strive to maintain a work environment that is free from unlawful harassment and discrimination.

Provides situational awareness to analysts and customers through the assembly of daily intelligence documents, briefings, and datasets.
