Duties: Designing, developing, testing, implementing, configuring and maintaining workflows and integrations for our Collibra Data Governance Center (DGC) and MetaCenter metadata management platforms. Implementing Collibra DGC workflows with workflow forms to enable data management capabilities. Leveraging Collibra API and Collibra Connect to implement integrations between Collibra and adjacent platforms. Designing, developing, performing unit testing and validation support for Metadata import and export jobs and creating data governance reporting/KPIs. Adhering to SDLC policies and standards for technical management of the Collibra DGC platform. Partnering with stakeholders for requirements gathering, integrations and processes and participating in meetings and working sessions. Partnering with data management and integration leads to continuously improve data management technologies and processes. Supporting implementation of upgrades and future developments of data governance tool suites. Maintaining a solid understanding of Collibra DGC capabilities and the product's roadmap to ensure effective technical design of solutions in the platform.Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Information Systems, or a related field (or foreign equivalent degree).Experience: 5 years of related technical experience with metadata platform management; and 3 years of experience must be in the financial services or banking industry implementing Collibra Data Governance Center (DGC) workflows; leveraging Collibra API and Collibra Connect to implement integrations between Collibra and adjacent platforms (JIRA, IDQ or MetaCenter); working with business stakeholders for requirements gathering, integrations and processes; adhering to SDLC policies and standards for technical management of the Collibra DGC platform; with reporting tools OBIEE, Tableau or Business Objects; and assisting in the implementation of upgrades to Collibra DGC.Certification: Position requires Collibra Expert Certification.Other: Required to be on-call during non-business hours for technical support.Location: Jersey City, NJ 07311We are committed to leveraging the diverse backgrounds, perspectives and experience of our workforce to create opportunities for our people and our business; Equal Opportunity Employer: Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran.

Duties:Overview:As the Senior Credit Analyst at Lakeland Bank you will support loan officers on a specific lending team and will respond to questions from internal and external customers in the lender's absence. You will independently, effectively and comprehensively research, analyze and underwrite loans for a variety of geographic locations and industries. The Senior Credit Analyst will prepare loan presentations for loan officers to present to Chief Loan Officer, Senior and Executive Loan Committees and periodically present loan requests to the appropriate committee. Presentations require independent industry, economic and company research, financial statement spreads construction funding, proforma and cash flow analysis and rental economics. The Senior Credit Analyst may manage smaller loan relationships.Key Responsibilities:Provide support to the Lending Team with the expectation of increasing and managing a commercial loan portfolio.Independently, effectively and comprehensively research, analyze and underwrite loans for a variety of geographic locations and industries.Calculate and analyze figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, ratios, commissions and percentages.Understand and effectively convey the level of risk associated with each loan transaction and propose mitigants, if any.Present loan requests to senior management and loan committees.Orders appropriate credit reports and searches.Prepare commitment letters, order and review loan documentation for closing.Directly and effectively communicate with customers and professionals, diplomatically expressing an opposing opinion and asking questions as required.Follow-up on past due loans and clearing exception items.Effectively communicate information and respond to questions in one-on-one and small group situations with professionals, regulators and internal employees of the organization.Monitor and recommend advances on construction loans and line of credit requests as required.Assist loan officers with portfolio management, including loans that are maturing or past due, loan modifications, tracking items, overdrafts and information requests.Accompany loan officers on customer calls, preparing data prior to the call, updating lender on account and loan status. Ask pertinent questions during the meeting, take notes for call memo preparation and following up with the customer, and other professionals regarding required documentation or questions.Manage customer data using Baker Hill software.Manage loan maturity list for timely renewal.Requirements:Business Degree from an accredited four-year college, with accounting or finance courses of a minimum 9 credits.Min 3 years’ experience working in a financial environment analyzing business and personal financial statements and tax returns; preparation of cash flows, rental economics, and researching economic data and a variety of resources to determine overall financial strength and future viability of the relationship being analyzed. This should include compiling the researched data into a comprehensive analysis for rendering decisions.Ability to effectively present information to top management, public groups, and/or boards of directors.Ability to read, analyze, and understand the most complex documentsAbility to respond to complex or difficult inquiries from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community.Experience and ability to work in a financial spreading system equivalent to Baker Hill.Ability to maintain strict confidentiality of customer data and operations.Excellent, effective verbal and written communication skills.Ability to develop and maintain relationships with clientsUnderstand customer relationshipsMastered advanced level accounting skillsIntermediate skill level with database, presentation/PowerPoint, Excel, WordBondable.Preferred individual will be or possess:Fully RMA credit trainedEmployment Eligibility:All Lakeland Bank employees must be bondable. FBI background checks are required to confirm eligibility for bonding. Note: A guilty plea or criminal conviction will not necessarily preclude employment at Lakeland Bank.Lakeland Bank is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, genetic information, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by lawScheduled Hours:Please be sure that you have the availability to work this schedule before applyingDayStart timeEnd time CommentsMonday 8:30am 5:00pm Alternate week (if applicable)Tuesday 8:30am 5:00pm Alternate week (if applicable)Wednesday 8:30am 5:00pm Alternate week (if applicable)Thursday 8:30am 5:00pm Alternate week (if applicable)Friday 8:30am 5:00pm Alternate week (if applicable)Saturday Alternate week (if applicable)Sunday Alternate week (if applicable)Total hours for the week 40Overtime - as needed

job_title: Enterprise Data, Financial Data Analyst - Content Design Specialist
description: We"re Bloomberg Enterprise Data - fast paced, innovative and expanding. We have worked hard and smart to become the $1bn business we are today. We partner closely with our clients, taking time to understand their unique businesses and individual data and technology needs. Our endless selection of datasets, covering all asset types, with multiple delivery technologies and flexible scheduling mean our clients are able to get exactly the data they need, when they need it, in the format they prefer. Without us, they simply can"t operate.What's the role?In this role you will be working with the Bloomberg Enterprise Data Product Management Team specifically on Reference, Regulatory, Alternative and Pricing Data. We are constantly improving our products, to make them more feature rich and application ready, whilst reducing the total cost of ownership. Product Managers have a high level of business, communication, and technology skills, so that they can create working prototypes, specify Engineering tasks, and work effectively with Sales and Clients.You will design, specify, and create prototypes of large and varied data models and data sets, both financial and non-financial, using a wide range of tools, methods and platforms.We expect you to evaluate areas of interest, understand what is possible and commercially viable, recognize which models and concepts should be applied, and how the data resources should be acquired. An open, creative approach is critical to your success.Whilst designing data for diverse addressable markets, you will explore and work with a wide range of data, and apply existing methods or develop new methods. You will also engage in data analysis in a practical way, convince business leaders that your results are worth investing in and educate other analysts and business team members.Most critically, you will deliver the output of your data design to business users (both non-technical and technical) and will be a key person in shaping the product offering and the customer experience.We"ll trust you to:Operate in an influential business role within a fast growing areaDesign and specify commercially attractive productsGrow your business and technology skillsUnderstand addressable marketsEvaluate what is possible and viableTake responsibility for the Data Architecture of multiple data setsWork with Engineering, Product Managers, Sales, and ClientsYou"ll need to have:Experience with financial dataFamiliar with specifying and using large structured data and data sets to solve complex business demandsExperience in working with Global Teams, across Sales, Technology, Operations and customersThe ability to address multiple priorities in an extremely fast-paced environmentIf this sounds like you:Apply if you think we're a good match! We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/solution/data-and-contentWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

POSITION SUMMARYUnder minimal supervision, this position is responsible for detailed research and credit analysis of complex credit requests in Commercial Credit Underwriting. This is a senior position. The incumbent is expected to have comprehensive knowledge of credit & risk analysis, credit rules, structuring of credits, regulations and documentation with the ability to exercise independent judgment within established Underwriting Guidelines and Credit Policy. At this level, the incumbent is expected to increasingly work with and assist the Commercial Loan Officers on customer calls and structuring deals. The incumbent will show leadership in training less experienced staff members and handle more complex and/or challenging assignments (e.g., larger deals or complicated request with greater exposure to the Bank). The incumbent will have a key role of consequence to the team outside of their credit related work. For instance, being an Administrator of the Credit Quest workflow software.

MAJOR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze customer and prospect financial information for renewals and new business

10% Prepare loan approval and credit analysis, assist in structuring loans.

60% Spread financial statements and verify covenant compliance.

10% Accompany Commercial Loan Officers on customer and prospect calls. Participate in discussions with management regarding creditworthiness of proposed loan requests.

10% Prepares reports and handles special assignments.

10%
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

Subject to business needs may have supervisory responsibilities.

SKILLS AND TRAINING

Thorough knowledge of underwriting and credit analysis.

Strong analytical skills with ability to highlight and mitigate risks.

Knowledge of commercial real estate lending.

Proficient in Commercial & Industrial lending including debt service coverage and cash flow.

Strong knowledge of and the ability to practically apply, modern office software (MSword, Excel).

Strong verbal and written communication.

Ability to prioritize multiple projects and complete them on time.

Ability to conduct meetings, effectively present information and respond to questions from

peers, auditors and various levels of management.

Sound grasp of accounting.

EDUCATION

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics. MBA preferred.

WORK EXPERIENCE

7 or more years in commercial banking

LICENSES AND/OR CERTIFICATES

Certification in Credit Risk or Credit Management preferred

WORKING CONDITIONS

Work is mainly performed in a normal office environment. Noise levels usually are moderate.

HAZARDS

The hazards are only those present in a normal office setting.

This job description may not be all-inclusive. Employees are expected to perform other duties as assigned and directed by management. Job descriptions and duties may be modified when deemed appropriate by management.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age 40 and over, color, disability, gender identity, genetic information, military or veteran status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation or any other applicable status protected by state or local law.

Company DescriptionWe’re a group of not-for-profit community health centers providing medical, dental and social services in neighborhoods throughout New York City. We provide confidential care to men, women, and children, regardless of citizenship status or ability to pay.Job DescriptionCommunity Healthcare Network is seeking for a Full-Time BUDGET ANALYST (FQHC) who under supervision of Director of Budget and Grants Management, prepares and maintains all grants & contracts functions and other assigned duties.JOB FUNCTION:Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Prepare program development budget for all State, Other Federal, City, Private foundation and legislative grants.Attend all planning meetings and follow-up with program and development as needed to complete budget and budget narrative. Bring any unresolved issues to the Supervisor.Perform program budget & expense analysis and propose adjusting journal entries as needed.Prepare and execute budget modifications throughout the fiscal year ensuring compliance with all funders and agency.Develop and maintain schedules for tracking budget and expenditures per program and category.Track, analyze, prepare and complete all schedules to produce claim vouchers within 15th to 30th day of the following month.Liaison with finance staff to coordinate correct allocation of budget & expenses.Monitor grants & contracts accounts and spending reimbursement trends, and advise Supervisor of issues.Reconcile monthly payroll and OTPS charges to each cost center to the general ledger no later than 15th of the following month; advise Supervisor of any unresolved issues.Maintain grants & contracts Aging of Receivable Schedule.Provide analytical and technical support to accounting staff as needed.Key Information:Job Type: 35 Hours per week (Full-time).Compensation: ranges between $50k- $57k per year.IND123QualificationsWhat We Look For:B.A. in Accounting.At least two (2) years of relevant, in-depth healthcare experienceStrong financial, analytical, technical and interpersonal skills.Knowledge of governmental accounting and generally accepted accounting principles, methods and procedures.Additional InformationWhat You Will Gain:Ability to be at forefront of integrated patient care.Supportive integrated team environment.Excellent Benefits and PTO package.All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

job_title: Actuarial Analyst, Private Client Group (Remote Opportunity)
description: Who we areAmerican International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.Get to know the businessGeneral Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services for commercial and personal insurance customers. It includes one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. General Insurance offers a broad range of products to customers through a diversified, multichannel distribution network.As an actuary at AIG, you will be challenged and encouraged to reach your greatest potential. Every day will bring new opportunities to stretch your analytical and problem- solving skills as you improve how we predict and mitigate risk. Our Financial Actuaries are on the frontlines, quantifying risk, pricing insurance and reserving losses for AIG’s major regulated and rated insurance operating companies globally. Portfolio Analytics and Pricing Actuaries support AIG’s businesses and are responsible for technical pricing, product development analytics and performance measurement. They collaborate with Marketing, Operations and Financial ManagementAbout the roleWhat you need to know:We are seeking an actuarial professional with industry expertise to join our Actuarial team within the AIG Private Client Group. The successful candidate will be working on US Personal Lines with the actuarial, product and/or finance teams to support versatile state pricing work, analytics/modeling, report building and data interface, and making reserve estimates. Depending on specific needs at the time, candidate may be required to do any of the following:Run and review rate indicationsDevelop rating proposals working with the Product teamSupport premium raters, and the rating validation & testing processExtract/review data quality and help build databases relevant to personal linesProduce state rate filings and respond to department inquiries and objectionsDo various pricing analysis on territories and /or segments as needed / requestedWork closely with the accounting and finance teams to support all monthly, quarterly and annual reporting needsApply and improve reserving methodsWork with analytics / modeling staff to interpret and apply research.Improve the documentation of all procedures in a clear and concise wayProvide timely support for all audit requestsAssist in the development of product and pricing strategies.Work extensively with the claims team to obtain updated loss informationWork closely with other actuaries in the unit on reserving / pricing / dataDevelop and maintain analysis to fit company process changes and add efficiency to current proceduresBuild / enhance reports and assist in developing product and/or actuarial reportsPrepare actuarial memorandumRespond to various ad hoc requests and special projects as they ariseWhat we’re looking for:BS in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related area.CAS Exam 5 and +, working towards Actuarial designationsProven track record in pricing/reserving, personal lines and/or high net worth experience preferredStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsStrong business and collaboration skills, and responsive to service needs and operational demandsProficiency in Excel required. SQL, R, or other similar programming languages preferred.Effective time management skillExcellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.Customer focusA look at our benefitsAt AIG, we have a 100-year legacy of working to make the world a better place. And that begins with our employees. We’re proud to offer a range of employee benefits and resources that help you protect what matters most – your health care, savings, financial protection, and wellbeing. We provide a variety of leaves for personal, health, family, and military needs. For example, the “Giving Back” program allows you to take up to 16 hours a year to volunteer in your community.We also believe in fostering our employees’ development and offer a range of learning opportunities for employees to hone their professional skills to position themselves for the next steps of their careers. AIG also has a tuition reimbursement program for eligible employees to enhance their education, skills, and knowledge in areas that relate to their current position or future positions to which they may transfer or progress.We are an Equal Opportunity EmployerIt has been and will continue to be the policy of American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories. At AIG, we believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our future and our mission – creating a foundation for a creative workplace that leads to innovation, growth, and profitability. Through a wide variety of programs and initiatives, we invest in each employee, seeking to ensure that our people are not only respected as individuals, but also truly valued for their unique perspectives.It has been and will continue to be the policy of American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.At AIG, we believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our future and our mission – creating a foundation for a creative workplace that leads to innovation, growth, and profitability. Through a wide variety of programs and initiatives, we invest in each employee, seeking to ensure that our people are not only respected as individuals, but also truly valued for their unique perspectives.We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law.Functional Area:AC - ActuarialEstimated Travel Percentage (%): No TravelRelocation Provided: NoAIG PC Global Services, Inc

job_title: Corporate Development and Sales Operations Analyst
description: Headquartered in Arlington, Virginia, IntraFi Network (formerly Promontory Network) – the nation’s largest deposit allocation service provider and the inventor of reciprocal deposits – provides dynamic, all-weather balance sheet and liquidity management solutions to help financial institutions grow franchise value. The company, chosen by thousands of banks since its founding nearly two decades ago, has assembled the largest bank network of its kind. Its solutions help institutions to acquire high-value, local relationships; purchase funding; and reduce collateralization costs.At IntraFi Network, we prosper by working hard in an open and creative environment. Our efforts to create and maintain a culture that values our people have led us to be designated among the top fintech companies to work for by American Banker. Promontory Network has also been recognized as one of the best places to work by the Washington Post’s Top Workplaces and the Washington Business Journal’s Best Places to Work. Our company is also recognized among Fortune’s lists of Best Workplaces—Small & Medium Businesses and Best Workplaces in Financial Services and Insurance.What is the role?This role presents a unique opportunity for an entrepreneurial, highly driven person with a well-rounded skill set to join the newly created corporate development and sales operations team. The ideal person for this role will need to have a strong grasp of finance, be a strategic thinker, and be both willing and eager to take on a variety of tasks.You should possess the experience and POSITION SUMMARY 

The Risk Analyst 2 is responsible for assisting the risk management department management with the conduct of the Enterprise Risk Management Program, providing staff support in guiding the organization through the complete lifecycle of the ERM process - risk identification, analysis, measurement, monitoring, and reporting. The Risk Analyst 2 will be responsible for assisting in identifying potential risks that may impact the Bank's overall strategy, business operations, or safety and soundness. Under the supervision of management, this position will assist with conducting and documenting risk assessment interviews, ensuring line of business partners are communicating key risks affecting their respective operations, as well as maintaining a centralized set of records that reflects various assessments and relevant metrics demonstrating the operations of the Bank’s risk management program. The individual may work in a variety of concentrations, which include and are not limited to enterprise risk; corporate governance; compliance risk; regulatory and operational risk; information and security risk; technology risk; market and credit risk; financial; and strategic risk.

MAJOR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES 
Supports the enterprise risk management effort by assisting management with the identification, evaluation, understanding, management, and communication of significant business risks, identifying gaps that may be present, and facilitating the creation and follow through on management action plans.

30% Provide liaison with Regulators to include managing information requests, and assist with timely and efficient reviews of the Bank’s operations.

25% Provides necessary ERM program updates, related analysis, and tracking of key risk indicators used to monitor the Company’s exposure to its various enterprise-level risk dimensions, and prepares scheduled enterprise risk reporting requirements/presentations. Works with ERM management and IT to define and create automated data feeds (Bots) from numerous source systems, reports and extracts to populate ERM analytics. Works with management as assigned to ensure complete, high-quality information flow to executive management, risk management committees, and the Risk Committee and/or the Board of Directors.

20% Develops and maintains a trusted, collaborative relationship with operational management to promote an appropriate level of engagement in risk activities with a high level of credibility for the ERM program. Uses interpersonal skills with an ability to partner effectively across all levels of the Company and develop positive and strong working relationships.

15% Maintains a working knowledge of state and federal laws and regulations affecting the risk management of financial institutions and all other jurisdictions affecting the operations of the Company.

10%
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

Project-based team lead where selectively assigned.

SKILLS AND TRAINING

Database, coding and advanced MS Excel experience preferred. Demonstrated conceptual thinker with the ability to analyze complex problems that include interrelationships and dependencies in order to identify common themes and solutions.Utilizes proper discretion and maturity in discussing confidential or sensitive matters.Ability to work independently with limited supervision. Ability to manage multiple projects, work in fast-paced environment, be results-oriented, and meet deadlines.The individual utilizes excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to communicate and further develop collaborative relationships across the organization in promoting an appropriate level of engagement in ERM activities. The individual excels in a fast paced and constantly changing environment. Develops and maintains a thorough and comprehensive understanding of risk identification, assessment and mitigation techniques and approaches to enable success and effectiveness.Inquisitive nature, resourceful, energetic, and positive outlook.Intermediate knowledge of banking regulations, enterprise risk management and internal control standards (e.g. COSO ERM framework).

EDUCATION 

BA/BS in Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, Engineering or related field preferred. Additional work experience may be considered.

WORK EXPERIENCE 

2-4 years of professional experience in risk management, financial services, business consulting, financial planning and analysis, or other.Experience with risk quantification, completing and/or reviewing Risk and Self Assessments required, and group facilitation skills (Preferred)

LICENSES AND/OR CERTIFICATES

Licenses and Certifications Expiration Date

None required.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Work is performed in a normal office environment. Noise levels are usually moderate.

HAZARDS

The hazards are mainly those present in a normal office setting.

This job description may not be all-inclusive. Employees are expected to perform other duties as assigned and directed by management. Job descriptions and duties may be modified when deemed appropriate by management.

Fund managers, compliance officers and middle office managers face the challenge of doing their job in the most efficient way possible. They need solutions that help them trade securities, attain best execution, and manage their risk, compliance and straight-through processing. Bloomberg"s Buy-side order, execution and position management system is designed to meet and exceed these needs.Our Team:The AIM Tradedesk is the first line of defense and first line of offense. Tradedesk Analysts are the domain and subject matter experts. We deliver a knowledgeable, and proactive service to Bloomberg clients and provide valuable insights that drive the business forward. We"re aligned to our industry leading Buy-side order management solution (AIM) that delivers global order, execution and position management tools for front-office professionals as well as middle and back office operations. Bloomberg clients rely on the service our Tradedesk Analysts provide to operate effectively.What"s the role?You"re a calm, knowledgeable force in a dynamic, volatile market. Our clients rely on your domain expertise to guide them, so that they can use the power of our Order Management System (OMS) to make better business decisions.You're a curious and inquisitive troubleshooter that is eager to share tips and insights about business critical features and exciting new functionality. Whether you're on a chat, getting on a call or on-site with your client, you can quickly size up a situation and provide a solution.Where can the role take me?Tradedesk Analysts love the excitement and teamwork of the role and continue to develop their career in the fast-paced world of client service. Most of our Analysts dive deeper to become subject matter experts in critical client workflows including Compliance, Order Management, Portfolio Analytics or Post Trade. Some of our Analysts progress into one of our Account Management, Sales or Implementations teams. Others utilize their visionary and analytical expertise in a role in Product. Another option is to challenge themselves in a leadership role. Diverse opportunities are what we do best; all while providing excellent service to our clients.The role can be broken down into 3 core areas:Client Service - At Bloomberg we pride ourselves on focusing on the client experience, providing them with the fastest and reliable solutions:You"ll use your product knowledge and acquired client intel to build and maintain credible relationships with your clientsYou"ll exceed client expectations by taking ownership and driving resolutionYou"ll create clear and up-to-date documentation of client needsYou"ll actively communicate effectively with external stakeholdersProduct and Domain Expertise - You"ll know your customers" business, our competitors, and Bloomberg"s product offerings:You"ll proactively develop your knowledge of our products and our customers" workflowsYou"ll share and build knowledge across the businessYou"ll apply product knowledge to enhance the customer experienceYou"ll stay ahead of what"s happening in the financial markets and understand the impact on our clientsBusiness Impact - the value-add brought to internal stakeholders, including Product, Sales, Implementation and Engineering:You"ll generate leads and contribute to Sales campaignsYou"ll validate, analyze and prioritize product enhancement requests and fixes for Product and EngineeringYou"ll provide valuable customer intelligence that drives product improvements and sales performanceYou'll need:2-5 years of experience in Financial Services and or TechnologyExperience in sell-side or buy-side markets and a great understanding of the full trade life cyclePrevious knowledge of an OMS or other electronic trading systemsTo be a self-starter: a proactive collaborator with strong multi-tasking skillsAttention to detail with strong analytical skillsKnowledge of regulations affecting the marketsKnowledge of connectivity protocols such as FIX, TNP, XML is a plusIf this sounds like you:Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are, but in the meantime we recommend you to have a look at these links:We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. The Position

Veracyte is seeking a Sales Operations Analyst to join our team. This is an excellent opportunity for applicants with Engineering/Mathematics background who are interested in learning about business management. The successful candidate will partner with our commercial leaders to drive and measure sales force performance by providing operational expertise and insights on analytics, reporting and incentive compensation. This person will be accountable for identifying and reporting on key indicators of sales performance and market opportunity, using those findings to put forth recommendations to leadership. Projects include business planning, market segmentation, pipeline analysis, coverage optimization, incentive compensation, and ongoing performance measurement. This is an opportunity to harness analytical and operational expertise to increase understanding of drivers that influence sales performance. This position reports to our Associate Director of Commercial Analytics and can be at remote, located in pacific or mountain time zone.

Key components of the role include:


Act as a to-go person for Commercial Leadership to provide timely analysis and actionable insights that will impact business
Develop and implement analysis that identify national and regional drivers behind sales performance including sales pipelines, trends, market share and customer segments
Manage data in Salesforce, in-house data warehouse and other data sources to capture different views into the business
Support the execution of operational processes including territory alignments, incentive compensation and reporting, marketing initiatives
Support commission/incentive award payments to sales personnel and ensure accuracy and timeliness of commission payments as outlined in the plan.
Contribute to the improvement of systems to effectively track or capture data.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as Finance, Sales Training, Marketing, Managed Care, HR and IT to provide holistic approach on business situations that affect deliverables.

Who You Are

You have a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics or related discipline and are looking forward to applying your analytical and problem-solving skills in business. You are able to handle complex tasks and deadline pressure while maintaining high attention to detail and quality. Deep analysis and reporting areas have included sales pipeline, territory potential, territory organization and territory optimization. You have Salesforce certifications and proficient knowledge of MS Excel including pivot tables, v-lookup and formulas. Collaboration is a strength of yours and you quickly develop relationships with peers across Sales, Operations, Marketing, Finance, HR, and others to be most effective in your role and recommendations.

What We Can Offer You

Veracyte is a growing company that offers significant career opportunities if you are curious, driven, patient-oriented and aspire to help us build a great company. We work collaboratively, offering you the opportunity to constantly learn from your colleagues – even those outside of your area of expertise. Here at Veracyte, we find fun, little ways to make it a great place to work – participate in our annual Halloween costume contest, treat yourself to free coffee or the endless supply of PB&J sandwiches, and toast with colleagues as we celebrate milestones. We also offer conveniences such as an on-site workout room and free shuttle service from both BART and CalTrain. We are a company with a heart and believe in positively impacting the world beyond our doors by providing our product to those who cannot afford it through a financial assistance program. Veracyte seeks the best employees and works to create an environment where they can thrive, expand their knowledge and contribute at the highest level. About Veracyte

Veracyte, Inc. is a leading genomic diagnostics company that is fundamentally improving patient care by resolving diagnostic uncertainty with evidence that is trustworthy and actionable. The Company’s products uniquely combine genomic technology, clinical science and machine learning to provide answers that give physicians and patients a clear path forward without risky, costly surgery that is often unnecessary. Since its founding in 2008, Veracyte has commercialized three genomic tests, which are transforming the diagnosis of thyroid cancer, lung cancer and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and collectively target a $2 billion market opportunity.

At Veracyte, we are more than just a diagnostics company. We are redefining diagnostic truth and changing patient care as we know it. We are improving the lives of patients by enabling the evolution of evidence-based clarity from scientific discovery. Our team embraces challenges - the more complex, the better. We are laser-focused and know how to prioritize. We act with a sense of urgency, because when it comes to advancing patient care, every minute matters. We take ownership of our work and are deeply committed to the success of our team. And, above all, we value integrity - in our work and how we treat all of our stakeholders, including each other.

Our accomplishments and innovation have earned us widespread recognition, from appearing on The Wall Street Journal Next Big Thing list to receiving the 2016 Edison Award, which honors product innovation and excellence. Yet the honor we are proudest of is being named a Top Workplace by the Bay Area News group four years in a row, based solely on feedback from our employees.

Veracyte affords equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons, regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, gender expression, veteran or marital status. Veracyte participates in E-Verify in the United States

Dome Construction is one of California’s most recognizable construction companies founded over 50 years ago. With a deep understanding and expertise in Commercial Interior, Life Sciences, Technology, and Healthcare building sectors, our clients range from the Fortune 500 to emerging startups. We were founded on principles centered on integrity, transparency, and a commitment for doing it right. We didn’t just want to do things right; we wanted to do things even better, and differently. Our vision was clear to be Your Contractor of Choice not only for clients, our trade partners, and most importantly our employees.

Clients tell us our superpower is to keenly understand their needs, envision, and deliver. Our work performed for repeat clients in any given year averages greater than 90% of our overall business – relationships run deep and are long-lasting.

At Dome, we believe that passion is as necessary as hard skills and talent, and why we seek team members who are curious, collaborative, and ready for a challenge. If you want to be part of something exceptional, then we would love to meet you.

Business Systems Manager

The Business Systems Manager (BSM) partners with Operations and House departments to identify, evaluate, prioritize, design, implement, and document continuous improvements of processes and systems throughout the organization in alignment with overall corporate strategy. The BSM will report to the Director of Innovation and Learning and oversee the work of Business Analysts.

Business Systems Manager Responsibilities:

Partner with Department Heads, Group Leaders, and Leadership team to identify, create, implement, and improve systems, processes, and standards.
Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and develop and implement solutions aligned with corporate strategic objectives.

Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Effectively communicate insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management to gain support for selected projects and improvements.
Evaluate the costs / benefits of system changes to ensure a reasonable return on investment.
Design, Implement, and Standardize a change management process that captures all existing systems and pending systems improvements. Note, systems improvements are not exclusively technology based.
Develop, implement, and maintain templates for Standard Operating Procedures.

Map the interconnectedness of all standard processes, systems, and tools.
Liaison between departments to ensure data entry redundancy is minimal and disparate systems are properly communicating and integrated.
Collaborate with IT manager, and DIAL (Department of Innovation and Learning) team to actualize objectives.
Lead Innovation Steering Committee (ISC)
Champion the successful implementation of process improvements selected by the ISC.

Manage competing resources and priorities.

Industry Knowledge

Stay current on the latest process and technology advancements to automate and modernize systems.
Attend relevant conferences and participate in peer networks.

job_title: Sales Analyst-Inside Sales Administration-Walnut Creek, CA/East Bay area
description: As a Sales Analyst/Assistant at Mutual of Omaha, everything you do will contribute to the success of the company. Its a challenging, exciting and fast-paced environment.If you have the power to excel in a fast-paced environment, and strive for operational excellence, combine your power with ours and see how far you can go.WHAT YOU'LL DO:Sales Support: Provide sales support to Sales staff members as assigned. Proactively manage quote activity and broker processes, and develop relationships with broker partners to help achieve sales goals. May make periodic visits with sales representatives to assist with Finalist Presentations, Enrollment meetings, and new client meetings. Serve as a liaison for Sales Staff, brokers, and home office business partners. Additional sales support/development may be assigned "as requested" by the RGM/Rep.Proposals: Receive RFPs from brokers, consultants and agents, enter RFP into GSAP. Prepare proposals, follow-up with requests to ensure a timely response, and review written proposals prior to presentation. Forward to group client for review.Rating: Underwrite and quote premium rates for life and long term disability cases generally under 500 lives and dental and short term disability cases under 100 lives. Throughout sales process, coordinate with underwriting to determine appropriate rate, and make revisions as necessary. Complete other case processing including Broker of Record entry, revisions, commission changes, etc.Sold Cases and Enrollments: Following the close of a sale, coordinate installation process by partnering with appropriate parties, using appropriate systems and ensure accuracy of paperwork (including master application). Manage supplies and materials required for Enrollment, to include voluntary cases. Review booklets and materials received from Home Office for accuracy and assemble for delivery to policyholder (on occasion may need to hand deliver).Product and Industry Knowledge: Ensure compliance of State Insurance Department regulations. Remain abreast of industry trends and product knowledge.Office Support: May open, screen, and distribute mail, identifying and ensuring proper disposition of correspondence requiring immediate attention. May perform office support functions such as greeting visitors, answering telephone calls and directing to appropriate person, handling invoices, processing conversion requests, office expense reporting, office time reporting, scheduling meetings and appointments, coordinating travel plans, and maintaining office files, supplies and equipment.This job posting is reflective of the Sales Analyst essential functions, qualifications, and physical requirements. The Senior level has variable essential functions, qualifications and physical requirements. Competency and skill set will determine level of placement within the posted job family.ABOUT YOU:You help promote a culture of diversity and inclusion within the department and the larger organization. You value different ideas and opinions. You listen courageously and remain curious in all that you do.You are able to work remotely and have access to high-speed internet.Knowledge and understanding of Group Operation procedures for underwriting and ratingEffective communication and human relations skillsProficient personal computer skills, including a working knowledge of various softwarepackages, and excellent typing, spelling, and grammar skillsUnderstanding of the laws governing the insurance industryWHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU:A diverse workplace where associates feel a sense of belonging.An organization that feels like a small, close-knit community and has the strength of a Fortune 500 company.Tuition reimbursement, training and career development.Comprehensive benefits plan that includes medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance.Flexible spending accounts for healthcare and childcare needs.401(k) plan with a 2% company contribution and 6% company match.Competitive pay with an opportunity for incentives for all associates.Flexible work schedules with a healthy amount of paid time off.For more information regarding available benefits, please visit our Career Site.Pay commensurate with experience.MUTUAL OF OMAHA:Mutual of Omaha serves more than 4.8 million individual product customers and 39,000 employer groups. Our legacy of stability creates an environment where every associate is encouraged to experiment, innovate and grow in their own unique career path.From day one, youll have the tools to be your best self at work. Here youll do meaningful work and your talents will have a positive impact on peoples lives as we help our customers protect what they care about and achieve their financial goals.Each associate is a unique contributor to creating a diverse, dynamic, thriving and inclusive workplace. We want you to become engaged … feel a sense of belonging … and contribute to the companys exceptional future.Join forces with a company that can AMPLIFY YOUR STRENGTHS AND EMPOWER YOUR CAREER.For inquiries about the position or application process, contact our HR Helpline at 1-800-365-1405.If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability. To request an accommodation, contact a Human Resources Representative at 1-800-780-0304. We are available Monday through Friday 7 am to 4:30 pm CST we will reply within 24 hours.Mutual of Omaha and its affiliates are an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer. To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.MuleSoft’s Professional Services team works across every technology to deliver solutions to customers in every industry. As a Business Systems Analyst (BSA) on our Services team, you will play a key role in our Professional Services practice growth. MuleSoft is the leader in implementing the application network by connecting data, devices and applications and we are pursuing people passionate about integration that enables digital transformation.As a BSA, you will be responsible for understanding client’s needs in order to determine how MuleSoft’s platform addresses the business problem at hand. BSA will be responsible for elicitation and documentation of integration requirements that are aligned with MuleSoft's design, architecture and implementation. Furthermore, BSA will be working closely with Solution Architects (SA) and Delivery Managers (DM) to ensure that provided requirements are sufficient to assess level of effort and design solutions for use cases in scope.Below are some of the responsibilities that you will carry out in your role as BSA:Gain understanding of client's environment and vision leveraging expertise around industry and business demandUnderstand business process and use cases and translate them into integration solutionElicit integration requirements with SA’s inputFacilitate requirements walkthroughDocument requirements and system interfaces in easily consumable formatSupport requirement prioritization and scope alignmentFacilitate sign-off to ensure alignment and obtain confirmation of integration requirementsWork with DM to align solution vision to KPIs and corresponding metricsPlay a key role in functional testing of the solution, making sure the KPIs and metrics are achieved.What You’ll AchieveFirst 3 monthsComplete Mulesoft training including our Mulesoft products, Catalyst methodologies for Services implementations and services offerings Complete BSA training, including Facilitation, Requirements Overview, and Integration Requirements for API-LedComplete training to understand the role of each Mulesoft team included in Services engagements - Customer Success, Engagement Management and Account TeamLearn the Center for Enablement (C4E) methodology for implementing organizational change management jointly with our clientsStart working on one or more billable client engagementsFirst 12 monthsWork on several projects as a BSA Independently produce high quality BSA deliverablesCollaborate with SA and DM, as well as client’s Business Analysis and technical team to make sure that MuleSoft solution meets client’s needsContinue expansion of knowledge for Mulesoft products and integration solutionsIdentify opportunities for client expansion by collaborating with the Account TeamContribute to the BSA methodology, expand and mature the practiceWhat You’ll Need to be SuccessfulMust possess 5+ years experience as a Business Systems AnalystRequires 3+ years experience in a consulting and/or client facing roleBachelor’s degree or industry equivalentProven track record of working in medium to large size IT organizations with multiple IT stakeholders. Experience facilitating requirements elicitation sessions with multiple stakeholdersExperience created requirements documentationWorking knowledge and experience with waterfall and agile methodologiesAbility to work in collaboration with a client’s business and technical teams to lead MuleSoft discovery Experience and track record of being part of large projects with formal methodologies for project and/or sprint plansProven ability to identify client expansion opportunitiesLeadership skills utilized to partner with Customer Success, Engagement Management and the Account Team to optimize client outcomesDemonstrated strong verbal and written communication skills including individual and small group presentationsAbout MuleSoft, a Salesforce companyOur mission is to help organizations change and innovate faster by making it easy to connect the world’s applications, data, and devices. Companies like Spotify, McDonald’s, and Unilever rely on MuleSoft to stay agile, deliver faster, and make the most of their IT investment with API-led connectivity. Hiring exceptional people who want to build a great company together is our number one priority, and we’re committed to providing an equal opportunity workplace where everyone is supported and inspired to do their best work. We work tirelessly to build this culture, and we’re proud to have been named the #1 Top Workplace in the Bay Area and a best place to work 6 years in a row.Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.Posting StatementAt Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. DescriptionBusiness AnalystSan Francisco, CAFirst Republic is an ultra-high-touch bank that provides extraordinary client service. We believe that one-on-one interactions build lasting relationships. We move quickly to serve our clients' needs so that their financial transactions are handled with ease and efficiency. Client trust and security are paramount in our line of business. Ultimately, our goal is unsurpassed client satisfaction.Incredible teams doing exceptional work, every dayWe recognize that our competitive advantage starts with our people and our culture. At First Republic, we work hard and move quickly as a very coordinated team. If you are looking for an opportunity to grow and contribute in a fun, fast-paced environment, First Republic is the place for you. We have exceptional people focused on providing extraordinary service.First Republic's "Continuous Process Improvement" (CPI) department is part of the Empower program within the bank - with a focus on empowering our people to deliver extraordinary service to clients. The CPI team works across the enterprise to support identification and resolution of operational improvement opportunities. The team solves for process improvements and product enhancements with a focus on client experience, operational efficiency and risk management. This department plays a key role in supporting the bank to scale while continuing to provide differentiated client service.ResponsibilitiesCommon goals, uncommon potentialA key aspect of this department is to implement solutions that improve our ability to provide exceptional client service. The right candidate will have a mindset to engage with our colleagues (front-line and operations) - understanding their processes and pain points, challenging the status-quo, evaluating additional opportunities, see the â€˜big-picture', and ultimately helping design a creative solution that will enable our colleagues to provide high-touch client service.To that end, the Business Analyst will partner closely with businesses to support process improvement initiatives. This includes engaging across various levels of the organization to identify problems and collaboratively define requirements and process changes/solutions, as appropriate. The Business Analyst will also help support implementations.The Business Analyst supports multiple lines of businesses on projects building and improving the data infrastructure. They build technical specifications that ensures businesses receive the right data sets for analytics, and internal and external reporting.This role requires an understanding of banking products, operations and system functionality. Candidates must be results-oriented and have excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders at various level.What you'll do as a Business Analyst:Keep the client and our front-line colleagues at the forefront of all analysis, requirements, process changes and solutions. Help enable high-touch, high-quality client service while scaling our processes to support volume growth and changing client needsSupport implementation of new capabilities and drive value from existing capabilitiesPerform dataanalysis and process design activities at the operational and organizational levelCoordinate the efforts of internal technical and non-technical staff, and of key business users for an initiativeWork with the business to come up with solutions for process improvementsEngage and direct business partners and subject matter experts to identify priorities and scope for medium business problemsDefine and document business requirementsProvide assistance in identifying, evaluating, and developing systems and procedures that are cost effective and meet business requirementsPlan and execute user acceptance testingCollaborate with management to ensure timely and successful resolution of project issuesSupport project planning and managing of business team deliverablesAttend/Coordinate/Lead meetings as requiredSupport production reporting systemsAdditional responsibilities include:Adhere to and comply with all applicable federate laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to Anti-Money Laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, USA PATRIOT Act, etc.)Adhere to Bank policies and proceduresComplete required trainingDISCLAIMER:Critical features of this job are described under the items above. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. This job description reflects Management's assignment of essential functions; it does not prescribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Nothing in this job description restricts Management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.QualificationsYou could be a great fit if you have:Professional and personable communication skills across multiple channels, such as email, phone, chat, and meetingsExcellent organizational, planning, and analytical skillsAbility to prioritize, multi-task, and handle competing deadlinesA team orientation to go beyond explicitly stated job duties to further team and company objectivesMentality that is open and eager to make improvementsProficiency in Microsoft Office applications, particularly for presentation of data reports (Excel, PowerPoint)Four Year degree or equivalent professional experience and/or qualificationsEducation, Experience, Certifications Required: Bachelor's degree and 5-10 years experience in process improvement, technology project design/development/implementation preferably within banking or financial services.Preferred: 2+ years experience in RPA project delivery.Technical KnowledgeProject/program management experience relating to technology deployment (e.g. RPA or other emerging technologies).Process re-engineering, change management and process automation experience required.Professional services, management consulting or project management preferred.Financial services industry preferred.Products & SoftwareBluePrism, UIPath, Automation Anywhere or equivalent industry-leading RPA platforms.Jira, TFS or equivalent project management softwareJob Demands:Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.Own your work and your career - apply nowAre you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability - that's the First Republic way. Come join us!This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. The Company is an equal opportunity employer. To the extent not inconsistent with our obligations under those federal laws and regulations, First Republic will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles and San Francisco ban-the-box laws.

OVERVIEWAt Instacart we solve for the customer. That extends beyond the hundreds of thousands of consumers we deliver groceries to and includes many leading and emerging consumer packaged goods (CPG) advertisers that want to shape how consumers perceive, shop, and stay loyal to their brands. Instacart's Brand Partnerships team is focused on serving these clients through our native advertising platform.We are hiring an Analyst to join the Sales Capability & Strategy team and lead the development of dashboards, tools, and analysis to ensure that leadership has the insights they need to measure the business. This work will range from building new leadership level dashboards in data visualization tools such as Tableau, to conducting one-off analysis to help identify and size a new revenue opportunity for the Ads business.ABOUT THE JOBPartner with Sales Leaders to design, development, and maintain of key dashboards needed to manage the businessDesign, coordinate, and deliver periodic reporting to Instacart's Brand Partnership leadership teamConduct ad hoc analysis, ranging from the development of new metrics to the identification of root causes for fluctuations in revenueWork independently as the key resource for day-to-day analytic needsRetrieve and aggregate data from multiple sources and compile it into a digestible and actionable formatSelf motivated to Identifying opportunity to automate and scale reportsABOUT YOU3+ years work experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analyst roleAbility to write complex, efficient, and eloquent SQL queries to extract dataStrong experience with data visualization tools, preferably TableauExperience working with Salesforce dataExcellent attention to detail, follow-through, and resourcefulnessAbility to independently manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize responsibilitiesAbility to work cross-functionally with many teams and multi-tasks with a sense of urgencyAbility to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast-paced environment and a willingness to lend a helping hand wherever it's neededNice to Have…Masters degree (MBA, Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics or related field)Advanced knowledge of data mining and experience with SQL, data warehousing, statistical analysis tools, Microsoft Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau; experience extracting and processing data using SQL and ExcelExcellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills, and an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teamExcellent organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlinesExposure to and understanding of digital advertisingExperience working closely with a distributed sales team

job_title: Business Analyst, Strategy & Operations, Google Fiber
description: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Irvine, CA, USA; Durham, NC, USA; San Francisco, CA, USAMinimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree with emphasis on quantitative coursework (Statistics, Business, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics) or equivalent practical experience.3 years of full-time work experience performing analytical work.Experience analyzing data and creating reports using SQL and/or languages similar to SQL.Preferred qualifications:5 years of full-time work experience performing analytical work.Experience with statistical (e.g. R, SAS), quantitative modeling and forecasting methods. Experience using Python for data analysis and/or automation purposes.Experience working with data visualization tools to deliver results (e.g. Data Studio, Tableau, Sisense, Looker, Qlikview, etc.).Excellent communication, presentation, and relationship management skills. Experience presenting to executive leadership.Exceptional problem solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills. Capable of translating quantitative results into recommendations.Capable of working on multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously, highly collaborative, able to build long-term relationships with cross-functional teams.About the jobAs a Business Analyst for Google Fiber, you will be working in the Strategy & Operations organization to solve a wide range of business problems across multiple functional areas. You will deploy a flexible analytical skill set to deliver insightful data and analysis, model business scenarios, define metrics, and address operational challenges with a quantitative approach. Your principal goal will be to use data to drive better business decisions. This means translating data into meaningful insights and recommendations and, where relevant, proactively implement improvements. The product of your work will be used by our leaders to make strategic decisions and serve as a key input in operational decision-making.You'll thrive when dealing with complex problems and ambiguity by using a variety of tools to find answers. You'll operate with limited guidance and have strong business partnering skills that you will proactively use. You won't be afraid to approach new, unique problems, and you'll be capable of working with large amounts of data with high attention to detail. You'll be curious and have an urge to go deeper and deeper into the data.“My internet is too fast!” ...said no one, ever. Google Fiber’s mission is to deliver abundant, reliable internet on networks that are always fast and open. On our team, you’ll work in a fast-paced environment that’s challenging the status quo in the broadband industry.ResponsibilitiesDrive analytical problem-solving and deep dives. Work with large, complex data sets. Solve difficult, non-routine problems, applying advanced quantitative methods.Collaborate with a wide variety of cross-functional partners to determine business needs, drive analytical projects from start to finish.Communicate findings, recommendations, and metrics updates to your management and other stakeholders via presentations, email communication, write-ups, etc.Act as a steward for critical business metrics and reporting, including development of new dashboards and data pipelines.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

We are a digitally native company where innovation, design and engineering meet scale. We use the latest technologies in the digital and cognitive field to empower organizations in every aspect.We want you to join us to work for the biggest clients in tech, retail, travel, banking, ecommerce and media, revolutionizing and growing their core businesses while helping them (and you!) stay ahead of the curve. Be part of a company with the most cutting-edge practices and technologiesplus a unique team.WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?This person leads the evaluation of business models, processes and operations to develop an in-depth understanding of business needs and requirements and identifies risks, assumptions and dependencies which will have an impact on their technical delivery. This person facilitates clear communication and trust between the Globant team and business stakeholders. Lead the identification of opportunities for additional services and projects Provide deep technical expertise to maximize value from new and existing IT products, solutions, and emerging technologies so that the clients receive the most value possible from the Globant team’s efforts Reviews processes and information technology required to introduce solutions and oversees modifications to systems and processes for efficiency, scale, and performance Leads the identification of risks, assumptions, and dependencies associated with the business and technical requirements, reviews and identifies any blockers andcommunicates to the relevant teams, and conducts scope management activities such as the identification and impact assessment of change Create effective end-user test plans to ensure successful deployments and to demonstrate the Globant team’s competency to the business stakeholders Oversees end user testing to determine if guarantee the solution meets businessrequirements Reviews insights and recommendations from multiple sources to verify that solutions and technologies being implemented are meeting meet business requirements and acts on recommendations to ensure alignment to business needs. Collaborates with stakeholders at all levels in the conduct of investigations for strategy studies, business requirements specifications and feasibility studies Leads the delivery of business cases which define potential benefits, options forachieving these benefits through development of new or changed processes, as well as associated business risks and leads delivery of RFP responsesWHAT WILL HELP YOU SUCCEED:Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Business Management, Computer Science, or Engineering 7+ years of experience in consulting services with proven ability to creatively assist client with their business challenges Have domain knowledge of one or more industries or sectors, with broad knowledge of current as well as emerging technologies 7+ years of Agile framework participating directly in Agile practices and producingcommon artifacts Understand product development and delivery framework especially Agile framework, DevOps practices and Micro services Significant relevant experience in either an internal or external business analysis role, or similar Significant technical knowledge and experience in delivering IT solutions, providing comprehensive technical advice and understanding user requirements Strong stakeholder management experience Advanced experience gathering and interpreting business requirements Advanced experience developing technical requirements and specifications, including knowledge of software engineering methodologies, reporting tools, modelling and testing. Experience implementing workflow, digital asset management, CRM, and ERP solutions for complex organizations Understanding of data models and experience with extract and analyze data sets Experience with data migration across systems with dissimilar technologies Competency in common IT business tools like Jira, Confluence, Visio, Word, and Excel Experience in producing training materials Experience with a 24x7 support model Ability to quickly gain competency in new technologies Familiarity with Digital Asset Management and/or Metadata Asset Management systems Familiarity with media workflow (e.g., order to distribution/broadcast) and Digital Supply ChainShare

JOB DESCRIPTIONYou’re an original. So are we.

We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we’ve used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi’s®, Dockers®, Denizen® and Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™

We are currently looking for a Business Analyst to support the successful roll out of LS&Co’s Global ERP implementation. This is a tactical role within the Direct-to-Consumer (DTC) track which will be tasked with building the foundation to scale LS&Co’s omni-channel business effectively as well as ensuring long-term success and growth by designing solutions that easily adapt to market changes. You will report to the Director, DTC Business Lead.

Responsibilities

Own the end to end results for integrating retail merchandising activities and flow into SAP and downstream systems with accountability over functions such as pricing and materials listing
Develop expertise in SAP requirements for material adoption and setup to enable stocking and selling of goods in owned and operated locations
Work with essential team members and IT to document current end to end processes and develop clear, comprehensive requirements, identifying where the business process might vary by region or channel
Understand and document key workflows, tools, data and analytics required by business operators and ensure that the design meets requirements to support current and future business models
Gather business reporting requirements, identify gaps in current reporting, partner with BI team and business teams to outline key design, validate end results
Understand operating KPIs and ensure business reporting requirements for DTC will be handled either in SAP Fiori or Hana based reporting
Manage risks and identify workarounds and processes to prevent disruptions
Own critical components of day to day pieces of the ERP project, partner with SMEs to align on standardized global design
Identify and recommend opportunities to streamline and enhance systems solutions and standardize business processes
Serve as SME for SIT, Training, and UAT efforts
Partner with business teams to design new processes as needed that will leverage new SAP features and functions, including supporting org design if needed
Ensure that all relevant partners and team members are informed of SAP functionalities from design through launch
Primary business partners are Merchandising, DTC operations, Data & Analytics, Master Data, and IT teams.

Qualifications and Desired Skills

Bachelor's Degree preferred
Minimum 4 years in a merchandising operations role or a business analyst role supporting pricing and sales activities with business teams as primary partners
Experience with technical project launches and implementing new business processes
Experience with SAP - implementation preferred
Strong technical acumen balanced by practical understanding of business operations
Knowledge of retail operating KPIs

Want to hear something crazy? Cars only spend 5% of their time driving. Where do they spend the other 95%? PARKED!

LAZ Parking is one of the largest and fastest growing parking companies in the country. LAZ operates hundreds of thousands of parking spaces across the country. When it comes to parking, were the experts!

We are also a PEOPLE FIRST company. We often say parking is our industry but people are our passion. Our mission is to create opportunities for our employees and value for our clients. If youre looking to join a growing company led by passionate people committed to being the best contact us today!

The Spirit of the Position:

TheBusiness Analystis an integral part of the evolving Technology team at LAZ Parking & reports to the GM of Business Intelligence. This role will be responsible for maximizing value for LAZ Operated Assets within their geographical area. Success in this role will be shown by the ability to be analytical, think outside of the box, and use data to drive decision making. The Regional Business Analyst will develop a comprehensive understanding of the local parking economy and implement yield management strategies to increase revenue and drive value to LAZ and client assets.

Principal Job Duties:

Develop and create dashboards within LAZ Parkings Business Intelligence platform powered by Microsofts PowerBI in concert with the national BI team directed by the General Manager of Business Intelligence. Develop and implement strategies through quantitative analysis of historical parking supply and demand as well as consumer and competition behavior Develop a working relationship with subject matter experts in the industry and within our field operations to understand the differences and challenges for each market 

Determine ideal pricing for various revenue streams through analysis of consumers online purchasing habits. Partner with distribution channels to ensure opportunities are maximized. Identify and communicate demand periods (high and low) for which a strategic plan is required and formulate and execute that plan with assistance from the Regional Operations Teams., Evaluate the effectiveness of implemented strategies related to revenue management and technology. Be the key point of contact for Business Intelligence users within their regions and assist with training or technical questions on LAZs BI Tool. 

Provide reports on a regular schedule through data collection such as: 

Average Number of Transient Parkers & Revenue Drivers. Contract Parker Occupancy and Absenteeism. Parking Patron Patterns and Trends, etc. Occupancy Reports and Trends LAZ locations versus competing locations.Create and disseminate additional reports as assigned.

Education:

BA / BS degree in a quantitative discipline such as Economics or Mathematics or Computers/Information Systems w/ a focus in data analytics.

Experience:

Experience developing & deploying enterprise-scale reports and dashboards using a BI Application such as Microsoft PowerBI or Tableau. 2+ years of related experience at within the Real Estate, Airline, or Hospitality Industry. Knowledge of logical and physical data modeling concepts. Experience in developing & using DAX Functions.

Skills:

Knowledge of Analytics / BI Applications such as Microsoft PowerBI or Tableau. Ability to utilize Data Warehouse Technology such as SQL, Non-SQL, and Azure solutions. Proven analytical skills, including the ability to gather data, analyze and present recommendations. 

Leverage understanding of internal and external business processes to identify problems and implement solutions to drive value. Interest in optimization problem-solving, economic game theory, and consumer buying behavior Ability to work independently and multi-task. Ability to communicate professionally and effectively with all levels of the organization. 

Demonstrate a sense of urgency and timeliness.

Physical Demands:

Ability to lift, push and pull at least 10 pounds.

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with qualified disabilities to perform the essential duties/functions.
